original: This work belongs to the Kubjikā school / the paścimāmnāya / It contains details of basic ritual procedures of this school / This work was probbly not written in Nepal where she is nowadays almost exclusiveely worshipped / The following reference in a colophon to Konkana / that is / the region around modern Goa suggests that it may have been composed there /
analyzed: this work beloogs to the kubjikā school the paścimāmnāya it contains details of basic ritual procedures of this school this work was probbly not written in nepal where she is nowadays almost exclusiveely the following reference in a colophon to konkana that is the region around modern goa suggests that it may have been composed there
translated: This work belongs to the Kubjika school, the Western Tradition. It contains details of basic ritual procedures of this school. This work was probably not written in Nepal, where she is now almost exclusively worshipped. The following reference in a colophon to Konkana, that is, the region around modern Goa, suggests that it may have been composed there.

original: iti sūtrasaṃgrahe śrīkauṃkaṇādhikāre
analyzed: iti sūtrasaṃgrahe śrī kauṃkaṇa adhikāre
translated: Thus in the Sutra Sangraha, in the section on Sri Konkana,

original: This not at all impossible as we know that much of the early history of this school is associated with that part of India /
analyzed: this not at all impossible as we know that much of the early history of this school is associated with that part of india
translated: This is not at all impossible, as we know that much of the early history of this school is associated with that part of India.

original: p /
analyzed: p a

original: oṃ namo gurupādukebhyaḥ //
analyzed: om namaḥ guru pādukebhyaḥ
translated: Om, salutations to the feet of the Guru.

original: aiṃ paraṃ prakāśamānaṃdamovalitrayavṛṃhitaṃ /
analyzed: aim param prakāśam ānanda movali traya vṛṃhitam
translated: AIM The supreme, shining bliss, expanded by the three circles,

original: ṣaṭprakāraṃ mahāsphāraṃ tatvaṃ vaṃde kuścaraṃ //
analyzed: ṣaṣ prakāram mahā sphāram vaṃde kuścaram
translated: The six-fold, greatly expansive reality, I praise the moving one.

original: ādau pacāṇayā sāmānyārghapātra kṛtvā //
analyzed: ādau sāmānya arghapātra kṛtvā
translated: In the beginning, having made the general argha vessel,

original: aiṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ kuṃḍamālinī avvā pāpū //
analyzed: aim hrīṃ śrīṃ kuṃḍamālinī
translated: AIM HRIM SHRIM Kundamalini Avva Papau.

original: icchāśakti avvā pāpū // jñānaśakti avvā pāpū // kṛyāśakti avvā pāpū //
analyzed: icchā śakti  jñāna śakti
translated: Iccha Shakti Avva Papau. Jñana Shakti Avva Papau. Kriya Shakti Avva Papau.

original: varṇamālina avvā pāpū //
analyzed: varṇamālinaḥ
translated: Varnamalini Avva Papau.

original: svāsane trikoṇaṃ saṃciṃtya koṇatraye tathā madhye uparipūjyaṃ //
analyzed: sva āsane trikoṇam saṃciṃtya koṇa traye tathā madhye upari pūjyam
translated: Having contemplated the triangle on one's seat, and in the three corners and in the middle, the deity to be worshipped above,

original: aiṃ yā sā śaktirbhagākhyā tripathagati yutā tryakṣa triprakārā hrīṃ tasyā śrī
analyzed: aim yā sā śaktiḥ bhaga ākhyā tripathagati yutā tryakṣa tri prakārā hrīṃ tasyāḥ śrī
translated: AIM That Shakti known as Bhaga, united with the three paths, three-eyed and three-fold, HRIM Her

original: oḍḍiyāṇaṃ parakala sahitaṃ madhyasaṃsthaṃ sudīptaṃ / śrītacchrī
analyzed: uḍḍiyānam para kala sahitam madhya saṃstham su dīptam
translated: Odiyan, accompanied by the supreme power, situated in the middle, well-illuminated,🔽The abode of Shri,🔽Jalandhara, the manifest abode, in the southern corner, KPHREM,

original: jālaṃdharākhyaṃ prakaṭita nilaya dakṣiṇa caiva koṇe khphreṃ vāme
analyzed: jālaṃdhara ākhyam ca eva koṇe khphreṃ vāme
translated: In the northern corner,

original: śrīpūrṇapīṭhaṃ paśubhayajana kṛtpurita yena viśvaṃ //
analyzed: śrī pūrṇapīṭham paśu bhaya jana kṛt purita yena viśvam
translated: The Shri Purnipeetha, which purifies the universe by frightening the fettered,

original: hsvaṃ tasyāgre śrīkāmarūpaṃ madanakalayutaṃ sarvasiddhālayaṃ ca śauṃ /
analyzed: hsvam tasya agre śrī kāmarūpam madana kalā yutam sarva siddha ālayam ca śauṃ
translated: In front of it, the Shri Kamarupa, united with the maddening power, the abode of all accomplishments, SHAM.

original: trikoṇāṃ tassamastaṃ paramaśivakalālaṃkṛtayogivṛṃdaṃ //
analyzed: trikoṇām paramaśiva kalā alaṃkṛta yogi vṛṃdam
translated: The entire Trikona is adorned with the group of yogis who are the supreme Shiva's kalas.

original: phreta madhye divyaliṃgaṃ paramasukhakaraṃ viṃdurūpaṃ kharūpaṃ klīṃ
analyzed: phreta madhye divya liṃgam parama sukha karam viṃdu rūpam kha rūpam klīṃ
translated: In the middle of Phre, the divine Linga, which is in the form of a bindu and the nature of space, is the source of supreme bliss. Klim

original: nityānaṃdasvarūpaṃ tadupari mathanaṃ ṣaṭprakārairvibhinnaṃ //
translated: The form of eternal bliss, above it is the churning, divided into six types.

original: glūṃ vidyābhogopabhogyaṃ anubhava vimalaṃ tisrapīṭhalalāṭe aiṃ evaṃ vyāptaṃ
analyzed: glūm vidyā bhoga upabhogyam anubhava vimalam tisra pīṭha lalāṭe aim evam vyāptam
translated: Glum, the object of enjoyment of the bliss of Vidyā, experience the pure one on the forehead of the seat of Trisa. Aim. Thus pervaded,

original: samastaṃ sthitilaya jananī rudraśaktistribhedaiḥ /
analyzed: samastam sthiti laya jananī rudra śaktiḥ tri bhedaiḥ
translated: the entire universe is pervaded by the mother of creation, sustenance, and dissolution, the Rudra Shakti, with three divisions.

original: p /
analyzed: p b

original: iṃ tatrasthā devadevī akulakulamayānaṃdadāvīsvataṃtrā bhruṃ /🔽uhvājñā / vaṃdhabhūtā paśubhayaharaṇī divyasiddhaugharūpā //
analyzed: iṃ tatrasthā devadevī akula kula maya ānanda dāvī svataṃtrā bhruṃ  vaṃdha bhūtā paśu bhaya haraṇī divya siddha ogha rūpā
translated: There, the goddess of gods, abiding in the state of bliss consisting of the Akula and Kula, self-sufficient, Bhrum.🔽The knowledge, the binding force, the remover of the fear of the bound soul, in the form of the current of divine Siddhas.

original: bleṃ nitya klinnā suraktā bhagamuditaparānaṃdaśaktiḥ prasiddhā kṣmā
analyzed: bleṃ nitya klinnā su raktā bhaga mudita para ānanda śaktiḥ prasiddhā kṣmā
translated: Blum, always moist, very passionate, the power of supreme bliss arising from the Yoni, well-known, the earth

original: kurvatītāni kāmān kṣubhitavaratanuṃ śrīkubjikākhyo namāmi //
analyzed: kurvatī itāni kāmān kṣubhita vara tanum śrī kubjikā ākhyaḥ namāmi
translated: granting those desires, with the excellent body agitated, I bow to the one called Shri Kubjika.

original: iti śaktisūtraṃ //🔽saṃtānamerumārge tu anvayasūtradevatā /
analyzed: iti śakti sūtram  saṃtāna meru mārge tu anvaya sūtra devatā
translated: Thus ends the Shakti Sutra.🔽In the path of the Meru of the lineage, the deity of the Anvaya Sutra

original: nirgamaḥ pīṭhaṃ ūkāre siddhaṃ dvayaṃ prakīrtitaṃ //
analyzed: nirgamaḥ pīṭham ūkāre siddham dvayam prakīrtitam
translated: The emergence, the seat, in the letter U, the pair is declared to be accomplished.

original: tūṣṇībhūto guhāvāsī vṛkṣaścaiva kadaṃvakaḥ /
analyzed: tūṣṇībhūtaḥ guhā vāsī vṛkṣaḥ ca eva kadaṃvakaḥ
translated: Silent, dwelling in a cave, and the tree is Kadamba.

original: saṃketaḥ siṃhikaḥ prokto avvā ca guhavāsinī //
analyzed: saṃketaḥ siṃhikaḥ proktaḥ avvā ca guhavāsinī
translated: The sign is said to be Siṃhikā, and the mother is said to dwell in the cave.

original: gṛhaṃ caṃdrapuraṃ proktaṃ bhedaṃ maṃthāna bhairavaṃ /
analyzed: gṛham caṃdrapuram proktam bhedam maṃthāna bhairavam
translated: The house is said to be Candra-pura, the division is Maṇṭhāna Bhairava.

original: gotraṃ amarikā devī vāmamāge prakalpayet //
analyzed: gotram amarikā devī vāma māge prakalpayet
translated: The clan is the goddess Amarkā, one should assign to the left side.

original: anvaye pratyayaṃ sāramadhikārastu koṃkaṇe /
analyzed: anvaye pratyayam sāram adhikāraḥ tu koṃkaṇe
translated: In the lineage, the essence is the conviction, and the authority is in Koṅkaṇa.

original: janma brahmaśilāsthāne sthitiḥ śrīkāmarūpake //
analyzed: janma brahmaśilā sthāne sthitiḥ śrī kāmarūpake
translated: The birth is in the place of the Brahmashila, the state is in the glorious Kāmarūpaka.

original: kīrtiściṃciṇi vṛkṣe tu siddhiścaiva tu sāgare /
analyzed: kīrtiḥ ciṃciṇi vṛkṣe tu siddhiḥ ca eva tu sāgare
translated: And the fame is in the Ciñciṇī tree, and the accomplishment is in the ocean.

original: tuṣṭahe tasya deveśa yojānāti kulakrama //
analyzed: tuṣṭahe tasya deveśa yaḥ jānāti kula krama
translated: O Lord of gods, he who knows the Kulakrama is satisfied.

original: iti saṃtānasūtraṃ //🔽p /
analyzed: iti saṃtāna sūtram  p a
translated: Thus ends the Sūtra of the Lineage.

original: aiṃ mitranāthāyavidmahe śrī śrīkaṃṭhāya dhīmahe siddhāsiddhi /
analyzed: aim śrī śrīkaṃṭhāya dhīmahe
translated: Aiṃ, we meditate on Mitranātha. Aiṃ, we meditate on Śrī Śrīkaṇṭha. Aiṃ, the accomplishment of accomplishment.

original: aiṃ mitranāthāya mūrddhni vaktrāya aiṃ aṃguṣṭhadvaye brahmaraṃdhre ca //
analyzed: aim mitranāthāya mūrddhni vaktrāya aim aṃguṣṭha dvaye brahmaraṃdhre ca
translated: Aiṃ, to the head and face of Mitranātha, Aiṃ on the two thumbs and the Brahmarandhra.

original: aiṃ vidmahe ūrddhvavaktrāya aiṃ mukhe punaraṃguṣṭhadvaye //
analyzed: aim vidmahe ūrddhva vaktrāya aim mukhe punar aṃguṣṭha dvaye
translated: Aiṃ, we meditate on the upward-facing face, Aiṃ in the mouth again on the two thumbs.

original: aiṃ śrī śrīkaṃṭhāya pūrvavaktrāya aiṃ tarjanikā dvaya hṛdaye ca / aiṃ
analyzed: aiṃ śrī śrīkaṃṭhāya pūrva vaktrāya aiṃ tarjanikā dvaya hṛdaye ca aiṃ
translated: Aiṃ, we meditate on Śrī Śrīkaṇṭha, the eastern face, Aiṃ on the two index fingers and the heart, Aiṃ.

original: dhīmahe dakṣiṇa vaktrāya aiṃ madhya dvaye nābhau ca // aiṃ tanno uttara vaktrāya /🔽anāmādvaye ūrūbhyāṃ ca // aiṃ siddhiḥ pracodayāt aiṃ kanīyasā dvaye
analyzed: dhīmahe dakṣiṇa vaktrāya aim madhya dvaye nābhau ca aim tat no uttara vaktrāya  anāmā dvaye ūrūbhyām ca aim siddhiḥ pracodayāt aim kanīyasā dvaye
translated: We meditate on the southern face, AIM in the two middle fingers and navel. AIM, may that inspire our northern face.

original: pādayāśca // iti vaktranyāsaḥ //
analyzed: iti vaktra nyāsaḥ
translated: In the two ring fingers and thighs. AIM, may success inspire us, AIM in the two little fingers and feet. Thus the face assignment.

original: mitranāthāya hṛdayāya aiṃ //🔽aiṃ vidmahe śirase aiṃ //
analyzed: mitra nāthāya hṛdayāya aiṃ  aim vidmahe śirase aim
translated: AIM to Mitra-natha, the heart.🔽AIM, we know, to the head. AIM.

original: aiṃ śrī śrīkaṃṭhāya śikhāyai aiṃ //
analyzed: aim śrī śrīkaṃṭhāya śikhāyai aim
translated: AIM, may there be prosperity to Sri-kantha, to the tuft. AIM.

original: aiṃ dhīmahe kavacāya aiṃ //🔽aiṃ tanno netratrayāya aiṃ //
analyzed: aim dhīmahe kavacāya aim  aim tat naḥ netratrayāya aim
translated: AIM, we meditate, to the armor. AIM.🔽AIM, may that inspire our three eyes. AIM.

original: aiṃ siddhiḥ pracodayādastrāya aiṃ //
analyzed: aim siddhiḥ pracodayāt astrāya aim
translated: AIM, may success inspire us, to the weapon. AIM.

original: ityaṃga nyāsaḥ pūrvavannyastavyaḥ //
analyzed: iti aṃga nyāsaḥ pūrvavat nyastavyaḥ
translated: Thus the limb assignment should be made as before.

original: digbaṃdhane astraṃ //
analyzed: digbaṃdhane astram
translated: In the binding of the directions, the weapon.

original: devī pūrṇopūrṇadehā raktavarṇā trinetrā kekarekṣaṇī / tripiṭanāśā ekavaktrāṃ
analyzed: devī pūrṇā upūrṇa dehā rakta varṇā tri netrā kekara īkṣaṇī tri piṭa nāśā eka vaktrā
translated: The Goddess, with a body full of fullness, red in color, with three eyes, rolling eyes, destroying the three baskets, with one face,

original: dvibhujā kapālaśūlahastā adho dṛṣṭiḥ harita pratoparisthitā /
analyzed: dvi bhujā kapāla śūla hastā adhas dṛṣṭiḥ
translated: two arms, holding a skull and trident, looking downward, standing on a green serpent.

original: prabhavai brahmabhāge kaṃdasthāne dhyāyet //
analyzed: brahma bhāge kaṃda sthāne dhyāyet
translated: One should meditate on her in the Brahmapada, in the place of the bulb.

original: p /
analyzed: p b
translated: AIM.

original: hsvauḥ śrīparāyai aiṃ //
analyzed: hsvauḥ śrīparāyai aiṃ
translated: HSVO: To the Supreme Goddess, AIM.🔽AIM.

original: anayā sapta vipruṣaḥ ūrddhe ekā adhaḥ / aiṃ hrīṃ saḥ sūryādi grahopagrahebhyaḥ
analyzed: anayā sapta vipruṣaḥ ūrddhe ekā adhas aim hrīṃ saḥ sūrya ādi graha upagrahebhyaḥ
translated: With this, seven drops above and one below. Aim Hrim Sah to the planets and sub-planets,

original: kāraṇebhyaḥ lokapālebhyaḥ nakṣatrebhyaḥ rāśibhyaḥ trayatriṃśaddeva🔽koṭībhyaḥ samastabhūtapretayakṣarākṣasapiśāca jātibhyaḥ //
analyzed: kāraṇebhyaḥ lokapālebhyaḥ nakṣatrebhyaḥ rāśibhyaḥ trayatriṃśat deva  koṭībhyaḥ samasta bhūta preta yakṣa rākṣasa piśāca jātibhyaḥ
translated: to the causal world guardians, to the lunar mansions, to the zodiacs, to the thirty-three crores of gods,🔽to all the classes of beings, ghosts, yakshas, rakshasas and pisachas.

original: pātāle cāṃtarikṣe ca martye ca bhuvanatraye /
analyzed: pātāle ca aṃtarikṣe ca martye ca bhuvanatraye
translated: In the nether world, in the sky, and in the mortal world, in the three worlds,

original: khecarī bhūcarīṇāṃ ca dikcarīsāṃ śivaṃ ūmaḥ //
analyzed: khecarī bhūcarīṇām ca śivam
translated: to the sky-walkers, earth-walkers, and direction-walkers, may there be peace, O Um.

original: jalatarpaṇaṃ //
analyzed: jala tarpaṇam
translated: Water libation.

original: na mṛdā na jalaṃ maṃtraṃ na tilādiṣu śodhanaṃ /
analyzed: na mṛdā na jalam maṃtram na tila ādiṣu śodhanam
translated: Not with clay, not with water, not with mantras, not with sesame seeds and such for purification,

original: malapradhvansanārthāya puṣṭyarthaṃ snānamācaret //🔽snātvā rājopacāreṇa apuṇya phalavāṃchayā /
analyzed: mala pradhvansana arthāya puṣṭi artham snānam ācaret  snātvā rāja upacāreṇa apuṇya phala vāṃchayā
translated: for the sake of destroying impurities, one should bathe for the sake of nourishment.🔽Having bathed with royal treatment, with the desire for the fruit of merit,

original: kuladravyaiśca saṃmārjya svatanuṃ guptacaryayā //🔽susūkṣmā paramābhāsā ūrṇātaṃtu svarūpiṇīṃ /
analyzed: kula dravyaiḥ ca saṃmārjya sva tanum gupta caryayā  su sūkṣmā parama ābhāsā ūrṇā taṃtu svarūpiṇīm
translated: having wiped one's own body with the substances of Kula, with secret conduct,🔽very subtle, of supreme radiance, having the form of a thread of wool,

original: lulaṃtī sā parā sūkṣmā amā saptādaśī kalā //
analyzed: lulaṃtī sā parā sūkṣmā amā saptādaśī kalā
translated: dancing, that supreme subtlety, the sixteenth digit of the moon,

original: śravaṃtī cāmṛtaṃ divyaṃ na tīrthaṃ niyamaṃ na ca /
analyzed: śravaṃtī ca amṛtam divyam na tīrtham niyamam na ca
translated: flowing, and divine nectar, not a holy place, not a vow,

original: śivatīrthaṃ mahātīrthaṃ tajano / na bhaviṣyati //
analyzed: śivatīrtham mahā tīrtham na bhaviṣyati
translated: the holy place of Shiva is the great holy place, that person will not be.

original: vimalaṃ tu nibhākārā suṣumnāṃtaḥ parākalā /
analyzed: vimalam tu nibha ākārā suṣumnā aṃtar parā kalā
translated: The form of Vimalā is pure, and the supreme energy is within Suṣumnā.

original: śravaṃtī śvetarūpeṇa unmanā sāgamāgamā //
analyzed: śravaṃtī śveta rūpeṇa unmanā sa āgama āgamā
translated: Flowing in the form of white, that is Unmanā, the coming and going of the scriptures.

original: vyāpinī ca padaṃ prāpya nādāṃ / yan /
analyzed: vyāpinī ca padam prāpya
translated: Having attained the state of Vyāpinī, the sound of the syllable yam.

original: nāvamādāya tatvasya snānaṃ mūlana maṃḍale // /🔽p /
analyzed: nāvam ādāya snānam maṃḍale  p a
translated: Taking the boat of the tattva, one should bathe in the root maṇḍala.

original: śivasnānaṃ trayolīnāṃ raudrī jñānaśalākayā //
analyzed: śivasnānam raudrī jñānaśalākayā
translated: The Śiva bath of the three lines is with the arrow of Rudra's knowledge.

original: iti prātaḥ saṃdhyāvidhiḥ //
analyzed: iti prātar saṃdhyā vidhiḥ
translated: Thus is the morning sandhyā rite.

original: aiṃ ṣaṣṭhanāthāya vidmahe śrīkumārāya dhīmahe / tanno lakṣmi pracodayāt aiṃ //
analyzed: aim ṣaṣṭhanāthāya vidmahe śrīkumārāya dhīmahe tat naḥ lakṣmi pracodayāt aim
translated: Om, we meditate on the Lord of the Sixth, the glorious Kumāra. May he inspire us with wealth. Om.

original: vaktrāṃgāṇi ca pūrvavat //
analyzed: vaktra aṃgāṇi ca pūrvavat
translated: The faces and limbs are as before.

original: aiṃ hrāṃ hrīṃ hrūṃ hraiṃ hrauṃ hraḥ aparāyai aiṃ //
analyzed: aim hrāṃ hrīṃ hrūm hraiṃ hraum hraḥ aparāyai aim
translated: Om hrām hrīm hrūm hraiṃ hraum hrah aparyāyāya om.

original: anayā saptavipruṣa ūrdhve // ekā'dhaḥ //🔽śvetāśvetāṃvaradharā surūpāṃ ekavaktrā trinetrā dvibhujā / karṇāṃtāyata
analyzed: anayā sapta vipruṣaḥ ūrdhve eka adhas  surūpā eka vaktrā tri netrā dvi bhujā
translated: With this, seven drops above, one below.🔽Clad in white garments, of beautiful form, with one face, three eyes, two arms, eyes extending to the ears,

original: netrā cāruhāsinī / kādya khaṭvāṃgadharā samadṛṣṭiḥ raktapreto paristhitā
analyzed: cāru hāsinī khaṭvāṃga dharā samadṛṣṭiḥ
translated: smiling sweetly, holding a skull-topped staff, with an even gaze, surrounded by red ghosts,

original: viṣṇubhāge hṛdaya dhyāyet // madhyāhna saṃdhyā //
analyzed: viṣṇubhāge hṛdaya dhyāyet madhyāhna saṃdhyā
translated: one should meditate on the heart in the region of Viṣṇu. This is the midday sandhyā.

original: aiṃ oḍḍunāthāya vidmahe śrīdurvāsāya dhīmahe / tanno kauliḥ pracodayāt aiṃ //
analyzed: aim oḍḍunāthāya vidmahe śrīdurvāsāya dhīmahe tat naḥ kauliḥ pracodayāt aim
translated: Om, we meditate on the Lord of Oḍḍiyāna, the wise one, the glorious Durvāsā. May that Kaula inspire us. Om.

original: vaktrāṃgāṇi ca pūrvavat //🔽aiṃ aghore ghoravadani bhīmabhīṣaṇe vamavama piva piva amṛtī kuru kuru ra ra ra
analyzed: vaktra aṃgāṇi ca pūrvavat  aim aghore ghora vadani bhīma bhīṣaṇe vama vama piva piva amṛtī kuru kuru ra ra ra
translated: The faces and limbs are as before.

original: ra raudri śrīparāparāyai aiṃ // anayā saptavipruṣa ūrddhve / eko adhaḥ //
analyzed: ra raudri śrī parāparāyai aim anayā sapta vipruṣaḥ ūrddhve ekaḥ adhas
translated: Om, to the terrible one, the fearful-faced one, the terrifying one, vomit, vomit, drink, drink, make immortal, make, R R, R Raudri, the glorious supreme and inferior one, Om. With this, seven drops above, one below.

original: kṛṣṇavarṇā suśuṣkā trinetrā dvibhujā kapāla ḍamaru hastā //🔽p /
analyzed: kṛṣṇa varṇā suśuṣkā tri netrā dvi bhujā kapāla ḍamaru hastā  p b
translated: Black-colored, very dry, three-eyed, two-armed, holding a skull and a ḍamaru drum.

original: ūrddhvadṛṣṭiḥ //
analyzed: ūrddhva dṛṣṭiḥ
translated: Looking upward.

original: śvetapreto paristhitā / sāyaṃ rudrabhāge bhrūmadhye dhyāyet // iti sāyaṃ
analyzed: sāyam rudrabhāge bhrū madhye dhyāyet iti sāyam
translated: Surrounded by a white ghost. In the evening, one should meditate on Rudra's portion between the eyebrows. This is the evening

original: saṃdhyāvidhiḥ //
analyzed: saṃdhyā vidhiḥ
translated: Sandhyā ritual.

original: upayokta sāmānyārgha pātreṇa dvārapūjā kāryā // aiṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ khphre
analyzed: upayokta sāmānya argha pātreṇa dvārapūjā kāryā aim hrīṃ śrīṃ khphre
translated: The door worship should be done with the general offering vessel. Om, Hrim, Shrim, Kshhpreem

original: hsvū devīputra śrīgaṇapatinātha pāpū aiṃ // devīputra śrīvaṭukanātha pāpū
analyzed: hsvū devī putra śrī gaṇapati nātha pāpū aiṃ devī putra śrī vaṭuka nātha pāpū
translated: Om, son of the Goddess, Lord Gaṇapati, be victorious. Om. Om, son of the Goddess, Lord Vaṭuka, be victorious.

original: aiṃ // śrīmārtaṃḍa bhairavī avvā pāpū aiṃ // dvārārddhe //
analyzed: aiṃ śrī mārtaṃḍa bhairavī avvā pāpū aiṃ dvāra arddhe
translated: Om. Om, Goddess Mārtaṇḍa Bhairavī, be victorious. Om. In the middle of the door.

original: śrīkālasaṃkarṣaṇī devī rāgadvayāṃtaki avvā pāpū aiṃ // dvāradakṣiṇe //
analyzed: śrī kāla saṃkarṣaṇī devī rāga dvaya antaki avvā pāpū aiṃ dvāra dakṣiṇe
translated: Om, Goddess Kāla-saṅkarṣaṇī, the destroyer of the two ends of passion, be victorious. Om. To the right of the door.

original: śrīśivādūtī devī dveṣadvayāṃtakī avvā pāpū aiṃ / // dvāravāme //
translated: Goddess Shivaduti, the destroyer of the two kinds of hatred, Avva Papau Aim.

original: śrīya bhaṭṭārikā devī avvā pāpū aiṃ // dehalyāṃ //
analyzed: śrīya bhaṭṭārikā devī avvā pāpū aiṃ dehalyām
translated: Goddess Shriy Bhavatarika, Avva Papau Aim.

original: śrīkṣetrādhipati uṃḍḍāmara bhairavanātha pāpū aiṃ dvāramadhye // iti
analyzed: śrī kṣetra adhipati uṃḍḍāmara bhairava nātha pāpū aim dvāra madhye iti
translated: Lord of the sacred place, Unddamara Bhairava, Papau Aim. In the middle of the door.

original: dvārapūjā //
analyzed: dvāra pūjā
translated: Thus, the door worship.

analyzed: hrī hraḥ hraḥ aghora astrāya khaḥ dvāra aṃta praviśya antar puṣpam ca

original: śrī udayāvalī avvā pādukāṃ pūjayāmi hsrūṃ khphreṃ śrīṃ hrīṃ aiṃ //🔽hsukṣmalvaryūṃ śrī akṣaya maṃḍalādhikāre śrīguru anādi ājñā śrīsamaya
analyzed: śrī udayāvalī pādukām pūjayāmi          śrī akṣaya maṃḍala adhikāre śrī guru anādi ājñā śrī samaya
translated: I worship the sandals of Sri Udayavali Avva. HSRUM KSHM SHRIM HRIM AIM.🔽HSRUKSHM LVARUM, in the authority of the imperishable mandala, the guru of the beginningless command, the auspicious one,

original: gurunātha śrīsamayāvalī avvā pāpū // hsakṣmalvaryūṃ śrī
analyzed: guru nātha śrī samaya āvalī śrī
translated: the guru of the samaya, the lord of the samaya, the sandals of Sri Samayavali Avva, I bow down. HSRUKSHM LVARUM, in the authority of the infinite mandala,

original: anaṃtamaṃḍalādhikāre śrīguru kaulikājñā śrīsarvajñagunātha🔽śrīsarvajñāvalī avvā pāpū // hsakṣmalvaryūṃ śrī amaramaṃḍalādhikāre
analyzed: ananta maṃḍala adhikāre śrī guru kaulika ājñā śrī sarvajñagunātha  śrī sarvajña āvalī pāpū śrī amara maṇḍala adhikāre

analyzed: śrī guru krama ājñā
translated: the guru of the successive command, the lord of the Kadamba guru, the sandals of Sri Kadambavali Avva, I bow down.

original: hsakṣmalvaryūṃ // hsakṣmalvaryūṃ śrī akhaṃḍamaṃḍalādhikāre
translated: HSRUKSHM LVARUM. HSRUKSHM LVARUM, in the authority of the unbroken mandala,

original: śrīgurukulājñā śrīkhaga gurunātha śrīkhagāvalī avvā pāpū hsakṣmalvaryūṃ
analyzed: śrī guru kula ājñā śrīkhaga guru nātha śrīkhaga āvalī
translated: the guru of the Kula command, the lord of the Khakha guru, the sandals of Sri Khakhavali Avva, I bow down. HSRUKSHM LVARUM.

original: iti gurumaṃḍala paṃcakaṃ hṛdayakaṃṭhatālu bhrūmadhya dvādaśāṃte
analyzed: iti guru maṃḍala pañcakam hṛdaya kaṃṭha tālu bhrū madhya dvādaśānte
translated: Thus, the five circles of the guru are in the heart, throat, palate, between the eyebrows, and at the end of the twelve.

original: śrī / ryaṃ śrīmahābhairavādhipati mitranātha /
translated: SHRI YAM, the lord of the great Bhairava, the friend of Mitra.

original: śakṣmalvaryīṃ śrīṣaṣṭhamadanasuṃdarī avvā pāpū // ṣaṣṭhamitragāyatrī //
analyzed: śakṣmalvaryīm śrī ṣaṣṭha madana suṃdarī ṣaṣṭha mitra gāyatrī
translated: SHAKSHMLVARIM, the sandals of the sixth Madana Sundari Avva, I bow down. The Gayatri of the sixth friend.

original: śrī uṃducaryā
analyzed: śrī uṃducaryā
translated: The venerable Udu conduct

original: p / 🔽pracodayāt aiṃ // hsakṣmalvaryaṃ śrīṣaṣṭhanātha / aiṃ śakṣmalvaryīṃ
analyzed: p a  pracodayāt aim hsakṣmalvaryam śrī ṣaṣṭhanātha aim śakṣmalvaryīṃ
translated: P.🔽May it inspire me. Aim. Hskṣmalvarya, the venerable Sixth Lord. Aim. Shaksmalvarī

original: śrīṣaṣṭhasuṃdarī avvā pāpū aiṃ // ṣaṣṭha gāyatrī vāme // hsakṣmalvaryūṃ śrī
analyzed: śrī ṣaṣṭha suṃdarī aiṃ ṣaṣṭha gāyatrī vāme
translated: The venerable Sixth Sundarī Avvā, I worship. Aim. The Sixth Gāyatrī on the left. Hskṣmalvarya ūṃ, the venerable

original: uṃdunātha śakṣmalvaryīṃ śrī uṃdusuṃdarī / pāpū
analyzed: uṃdunātha śakṣmalvaryīṃ śrī uṃdusundarī
translated: Udu Lord. Shaksmalvarī. The venerable Udu Sundarī. I worship.

original: aiṃ // uṃdu gāyatrī agre pūjyā // śrīśāṃbhavādhikāre hsakhphreṃ / śrī🔽unmanāyī śrīsajājñā / hsakṣmalvaryūṃ śrīvṛkṣanātha śrītūṣṇīśanātha
analyzed: aim uṃdu gāyatrī agre pūjyā śrī śāṃbhava adhikāre   śrī  unmanāyī śrī sajājñā  śrī vṛkṣa nātha śrī tūṣṇīśa nātha
translated: Aim. The Udu Gāyatrī should be worshipped in front. In the authority of the venerable Śambhu, hskṣphreṃ. The venerable🔽Unmanā, the venerable Sajjā Command. Hskṣmalvarya ūṃ, the venerable Tree Lord, the venerable Tūṣṇīśa Lord

original: śrīśrīnātha pāpū aiṃ // aiṃ vṛkṣanāthāya vidmahe śrībhairavāya dhīmahe
analyzed: śrī śrīnātha aim aim vṛkṣanāthāya vidmahe śrībhairavāya dhīmahe
translated: The venerable Śrīnātha, I worship. Aim. Aim. To the Tree Lord, we offer our knowledge. To the venerable Bhairava, we offer our meditation.

original: tanno kubjiḥ pracodayāt aiṃ punarmadhye pūjyā // iti śrīnādipaṃcakaṃ gāyatrī🔽sahitaṃ // śrī unmana vyonni śrī unmanāyīsaṃ śrībhṛgunātha pāpū aiṃ //🔽śrīmanonmanavyomni śrīmanonmanāyī haṃ śrīlakulīśanātha pāpū aiṃ //
analyzed: tat naḥ kubjiḥ pracodayāt aim punar madhye pūjyā iti śrī nādi paṃcakam gāyatrī  sahitam śrī unmana śrī unmanāyīsam śrī bhṛgunātha aiṃ  śrī manonmana vyomni śrī manonmanāyī haṃ śrī lakulīśa nātha aiṃ
translated: May the Kubjā inspire us. Aim. Again, in the middle, the worship should be done. Thus, the venerable Nādipañcaka (Five concerning the Channels) along with the Gāyatrī🔽The venerable Unmanavyomni, the venerable Unmanāyīsa, the venerable Bhṛgunātha, I worship. Aim.🔽In the venerable Manonmanavyomni, the venerable Manonmanāyī haṃ, the venerable Lakulīśanātha, I worship. Aim.

original: śrīsamanāvyonni śrīsamanāyī kṣaṃ śrīsaṃvartanātha pāpū aiṃ //
analyzed: śrī samanāvī onni śrī samanāyī kṣaṃ śrī saṃvartanātha pāpū aiṃ
translated: In the venerable Samanavyomni, the venerable Samanāyī kṣaṃ, the venerable Saṃvartanātha, I worship. Aim.

original: śrīvyāpinyā vyomni śrīvyāpinyāyīmaṃ śrīmahākālānalanātha pāpū aiṃ //🔽p /
analyzed: śrī vyāpinyā vyomni śrī vyāpinyai imam śrī mahākāla analanātha pāpū aiṃ  p b
translated: In the sky of the glorious Vyāpinī, the glorious Vyāpinī, the lord of the great Kāla fire, Pāpū, Aiṃ.

original: śrīśāktavyomni śrīnirodhinyāyī laṃ śrīpinākīśanātha pāpū aiṃ //🔽śrīdhvanyaṃta vyomni śrīnāhatāyī vaṃ śrīkhaḍgīśanātha pāpū aiṃ //
analyzed: śrī śākta vyomni śrī nirodhi nyāyī laṃ śrī pinākīśa nātha pāpū aiṃ  vyomni śrī nāha tāyī vaṃ śrīkhaḍgīśa nātha pāpū aiṃ
translated: In the sky of the glorious Śāktā, the glorious Nirodhini, Laṃ, the lord of the Pinākī, Pāpū, Aiṃ.🔽In the sky of the glorious Dhvanyanta, the glorious Nāhatā, Vaṃ, the lord of the Khaḍgin, Pāpū, Aiṃ.

original: śrīnādavyomni śrīnādinyāyī raṃ śrībhuṃjaṃgīśanātha pāpū aiṃ // śrī🔽arddhacaṃdravyomni śrī āhlādinyāyī yaṃ śrīvāgīśanātha pāpū aiṃ //
analyzed: śrī nāda vyomni śrī nādinyāyī raṃ śrī bhuṃjaṃgīśa nātha pāpū aiṃ śrī  arddhacandra vyomni śrī āhlādinyāyī yaṃ śrī vāgīśanātha pāpū aiṃ
translated: In the sky of the glorious Nāda, the glorious Nādini, Raṃ, the lord of the Bhujaṅgin, Pāpū, Aiṃ.🔽In the sky of the glorious Ardhacaṇḍa, the glorious Āhlādinī, Yaṃ, the lord of the Vāgīśa, Pāpū, Aiṃ.

original: śrīvinduvyomni śrī amṛtavarṣiṇyāyī ūṃ śrī arghīśanātha pāpū aiṃ // iti
analyzed: śrī vindu vyomni ūm śrī arghīśa nātha pāpū aiṃ iti
translated: In the sky of the glorious Viṇḍu, the glorious Amṛtavarṣiṇī, Ūṃ, the lord of the Arghīśa, Pāpū, Aiṃ. Thus,

original: siddhanavakaṃ brahmaśilāyāṃ navātma saṃketa krameṇa pūjyaṃ //
analyzed: siddha navakam brahmaśilāyām nava ātma saṃketa krameṇa pūjyam
translated: the group of nine Siddhas should be worshipped in the Brahmashila in the sequence of the nine-fold convention.

analyzed: aim
translated: Aiṃ. Hṣa Kṣma Lva Ryiṃ, the glorious Bhairavānanda, Pāpū, Aiṃ. Hṣa Kṣma Lva Ryuṃ

translated: The venerable Devānandana, Pāpū, Aiṃ. Hṣakṣmalvarūṃ, the venerable Kamalānandana, Pāpū,

analyzed: aim śrī śivānandanātha pāpū aim
translated: Aim. Hsakshmalvargye Shri Shivaananda Natha Papau Aim. Hsakshmalvargye.

analyzed: śrī rāma ānanda nātha pāpū aiṃ
translated: The venerable Ramananda Natha, Pupa, Aum.

Aum, Hssraum, Shri, the Tri-void, the Pervader, the Lady, the Mother, Aum. Thus,

original: paṃcavāhākhyaṃ parakramaṃ parānte pūjayet // āṃ śrīsiṃhakīrtinātha iṃ
analyzed: paṃcavāha ākhyam para kramam parānte pūjayet āṃ śrī siṃhakīrtināthaḥ iṃ
translated: one should worship the supreme sequence called the Five Conveyances at the end of the supreme. Aum, Shri, the Lord of Lion's Fame, I.

original: śrīsuśuddhāvvā pāpū aiṃ // iṃ śrī avyaktanātha uṃ śrī avyaktāvvā pāpū
analyzed: śrī suśuddhau vā pāpū aiṃ iṃ śrī avyaktanātha um śrī avyaktau vā pāpū
translated: Shri, the Pure Lady, the Mother, Aum. I, Shri, the Unmanifest Lord, U, Shri, the Unmanifest Lady, the Mother, Aum.

original: aiṃ // ūṃ śrīyonicakrakrāminātha ṛṃ śrīyonicakrakrāmiṇī avvā pāpū aiṃ //
analyzed: aim ūm śrī yonicakra krāmināthaiḥ ṛṃ śrī yonicakra krāmiṇī aim
translated: U, Shri, the Lord who traverses the Yoni Wheel, R, Shri, the Yoni Wheel Traverser Lady, the Mother, Aum.

original: p / 🔽śrīkālikanāha ḷ śrīkālikāvvā pāpū aiṃ // ḹṃ śrī ūhakanātha eṃ śrī
analyzed: p a
translated: P.🔽Shri, the Lord of Kali, L, Shri, the Kali Lady, the Mother, Aum. L, Shri, the Lord of Uha, E, Shri,

original: ūhakāvvā pāpū aiṃ // ūṃ śrīparvādyanātha ṛṃ śrīparvādyāvvā pāpū aiṃ
analyzed: ūhakau vā pāpū aiṃ ūm śrīparva ādi anāthaiḥ ṛṃ śrīparva ādyau vā pāpū aiṃ
translated: the Uha Lady, the Mother, Aum. U, Shri, the Lord of Parva and the Beginning, R, Shri, the Parva and Beginning Lady, the Mother, Aum.

original: aṃ śrī rakṣādyanātha aḥ śrīrakṣiṇī avvā pāpū aiṃ // aiṃ hsa khphreṃ aiṃ //
analyzed: aṃ śrī rakṣa ādyanāthaiḥ śrī rakṣiṇī aiṃ aiṃ hsa khphreṃ aiṃ
translated: Aiṃ Hsa Kphreṃ Aiṃ.

original: ekākṣarā madhye pūjyā japyā ca // iti sūkṣmākhyo prakāsa kramaḥ saptakaṃ
analyzed: eka akṣarā madhye pūjyā japyā ca iti
translated: The one-syllabled one should be worshipped and repeated in the middle. Thus is the seven-fold prakāśa-krama called Sūkṣma.

original: sūkṣmāṃte pūjyaṃ //
analyzed: sūkṣma aṃte pūjyam
translated: The Sūkṣma should be worshipped at the end.

original: vyomeśyā sahitāḥ sarvā guruvaktropadeśataḥ /
analyzed: vyomeśyā sahitāḥ sarvāḥ guru vaktra upadeśataḥ
translated: All of them are united with Vyoma-śyā (the dark one of the sky), according to the instruction of the guru's mouth.

original: kakromi vyoma khaca / krameṇaiva ca yojayet //
analyzed: kakromi vyoma khaca krameṇa eva ca yojayet
translated: One should combine with the sky in the order of K, K, K, K, and K.

original: tathāpyatra kramaṃ vakṣye saṃketākṣarakaiḥ śubhaiḥ /
analyzed: tathā api atra kramam vakṣye saṃketa akṣarakaiḥ śubhaiḥ
translated: Even so, I will speak of the sequence here with auspicious symbolic letters.

original: gaprapravyoghasijñā ca dhvā / kajñā tu ca kūkavai cha e si /
analyzed: ga pra pra vya gha si jñā ca dhvā ka jñā tu ca kū ka vai cha e si
translated: G, Pra, Pra, Vyoma, Ghas, Jñā, Dhva, K, Jñā, and Kūka, Vai, Cha, E, Si.

original: ja ca dhaścāpi / khā amaśca ṛsakra ca / ṭasokaṃ tu ṭhalākaśca / ḍuḍāyo
analyzed: ja ca dhaḥ ca api khāḥ amaḥ ca ca ca  ṭasokam tu ṭhalākaḥ ca
translated: Ja, Dha, and Cha, Kha, A, Ma, and Ṛ, Sa, Kra, Cha, and Ṭ, So, Ka, and Ṭha, Lā, Ka, and Ḍu, Ḍā,

original: punareva ca / ḍha aviścaṇa uyavaiḥ ta āya khadikastathā dadhādhau vaidhamī
analyzed: punar eva ca khadikaḥ tathā vaidhamī
translated: And again, Ḍha, Avi, Cha, Ṇa, U, Yava, Tai, Ā, Kha, Dika, and Dha, Dha, and Dha, Vai, Dhā,

original: praśca name vipalauvīśu ca / phaśira / pallagā caiva / tadvikro mamasustathā
analyzed: ca ca ca eva
translated: Pra, and Na, Me, Vi, Pala, Vī, Śu, Cha, Pha, Śira, Pallaga, and Tva, Vikro, Ma, Su, and Sva,

original: p / 🔽yavāvarabhusviścaiva lapiśavakhabhūstathā /
analyzed: p b  yava avara bhusviḥ ca eva lapi śava kha bhūḥ tathā
translated: P.🔽Ya, Vā, Vara, Bhu, Sva, Vi, Cha, La, Pi, Śava, Kha, Bhū, and Sva.

original: śavaduśca ṣaśveduśca sabhṛprahacala pravai //
analyzed: śavaduḥ ca ṣaśveduḥ ca sa bhṛ praha cala pravai
translated: Śava, Du, Cha, Ṣa, Śva, Ed, U, Sa, Bhṛ, Pra, Ha, Cha, La, and Pra, Vai.

original: kṣaprasaṃbhamāvadetaccatustriṃśābjasaṃkhyayā /
analyzed: kṣapra saṃbhamā vat etat catustriṃśa abja saṃkhyayā
translated: This is to be done in the order of the thirty-four petals.

original: vyomeśvarīti sarvāsāṃ paścāddeyā hyanukramāt //
analyzed: vyomeśvarī iti sarvāsām paścāt deyā hi anukramāt
translated: After that, Vyomaeshvari should be offered to all in order.

original: evaṃ krameṇa kartavyaṃ varṇakrama mahodayaṃ //
analyzed: evam krameṇa kartavyam
translated: Thus, the great rising of the sequence of letters should be done in order.

original: iti śrīsamyak sūtragaṃjakāt //
analyzed: iti śrī samyak sūtra gaṃjakāt
translated: Thus, from the Samyak Sutra Ganjaka.

analyzed: bhakam kakalā ādyā krodha bhairava mitra vyomeśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ gakhaṃ  sva kalā ādyā caṃḍabhairava bhūta vyomeśvarī pāpū aiṃ vagaṃgaṇa ādyā
translated: The Bhaka, Kakala, etc., Krodha Bhairava, Mitra, Vyomaeshvari, Avva, Papau, Aim. The Gkha,🔽Svakala, etc., Chandabhairava, Bhuta, Vyomaeshvari, Avva, Papau, Aim. The Vga, Gana, etc.,

analyzed: pracaṃḍa bhairava prabhūta vyomeśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ tighaṃghasmara ādyā
translated: Prachandabhairava, Prabhuta, Vyomaeshvari, Avva, Papau, Aim. The Ti, Gha, Ghasmara, etc.,

analyzed: kapardi bhairava jvālā mālini vyomeśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ vecaṃ
translated: Shiva Bhairava, Jvalini, Vyomaeshvari, Avva, Papau, Aim. The A, Nga, Jnananetra, etc.,🔽Kapardi Bhairava, Jvala, Malini, Vyomaeshvari, Avva, Papau, Aim. The Ve, Cha,

analyzed: cāmuṃḍā ādyā kūrmabhairava kalpinī vyomeśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ hsa khphreṃ
translated: Chamunda, etc., Kurma Bhairava, Kalpini, Vyomaeshvari, Avva, Papau, Aim. The Hsa, Kphrem,

analyzed: chaṃ chalatrāsinī ādyā ekanetra bhairava siddha śakti vyomeśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ
translated: Chha, Chhala, Trasini, etc., Ekanethra Bhairava, Siddha Shakti, Vyomaeshvari, Avva, Papau, Aim.

translated: The glorious Jāṇajā and others, O Four-faced Bhairava.

analyzed: bhairava kradinī śakti vyomeśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ  ṭaṃka ādyā someśvara bhairava kaṃdalī śakti vyomeśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ

translated: the mother, the beloved, AIM.🔽The Ḍaṇḍāmara and others, O Ḍāruka Bhairava, the power of the knowledge of the Yoginī,🔽the mistress of the sky, the mother, the beloved, AIM.🔽The Ḍha and others, O Ardha-nārīśvara Bhairava, the lightning, the mistress of the sky,

original: bhairavavidyuṃtā vyomeśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ // ṅa ṇaṃṇati pṛyādyā🔽umākāṃtaṃ bhairavayaśāvara vyomeśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ // ña taṃtaraṇi

translated: The Ta and others, O Tantra-tarpaṇa Bhairava, the power of the Yakṣī, the mistress of the sky,🔽the mother, the beloved, AIM.

translated: The place, Kala, etc., the group of Bhairavas, the goddess of action, the mistress of the Void, the mother, the beloved, Aum.

analyzed: nadam  p  medham dhana ādi āmīna bhairava pravodha śakti vyomeśvarī avvā pāpū aim

original: anaṃ nayanādyā meṣa bhairava vimalāśakti vyomeśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ //🔽ghopaṃ parādyā lohita bhairava vibhatsā śakti vyomeśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ //
analyzed: nayana ādyā meṣa bhairava vimalā śakti vyomeśvarī avvā pāpū aim  ghopam parā ādyā lohita bhairava vibhatsā śakti vyomeśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ
translated: The self, the one who guides the eyes, etc., the Bhairava of the ram, the power of purity, the mistress of the Void, the mother, the beloved, Aum.🔽The throat, the one who begins with the supreme, etc., the Bhairava of the blood, the power of division, the mistress of the Void, the mother, the beloved, Aum.

analyzed: vidyā vyomeśvarī aiṃ                  aim khebham bhava bhedinī ādyāt viriṃḍa bhairavaiḥ krodhī śakti vyomeśvarī

original: avvā pāpū aiṃ // chāṃ maṃ maṃtrādyā mahākāla bhairava suvarṇa rājaśakti
analyzed: aim chāṃ maṃ maṃtra ādyā mahākāla bhairava suvarṇa rājaśakti
translated: the mother, the beloved, Aum. The letter cha, the one who begins with the mantra, etc., the Bhairava of the great time, the power of the king of gold,

original: vyomeśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ // chīṃ yaṃ yaśa pṛyādyā vālīśa bhairavavanyā
analyzed: vyomeśvarī avvā pāpū aim chīṃ yaṃ yaśa pṛyā ādyā vālīśa bhairava vanyā
translated: Vyoma Ishvari Avva Papau Aim. Chim Yam Yash Priya and others, Valli Sha Bhairava Vanya

original: śakti vyomeśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ // kiraṃ rati cakrādyā bhujaṃga bhairava🔽siṃdūrā śakti vyomeśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ // nilaṃ laṃpaṭādyā pināka
analyzed: śakti vyomeśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ kiraṃ rati cakra ādyā bhujaṃga bhairava  siṃdūrā śakti vyomeśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ nilaṃ laṃpaṭa ādyā pināka
translated: Shakti Vyoma Ishvari Avva Papau Aim. Kirum Rati Chakra and others, Bhujang Bhairava🔽Sindhu Sha Shakti Vyoma Ishvari Avva Papau Aim. Nilum Lampata and others, Pinaka

analyzed: bhairava śaśinī śakti vyomeśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ kivaṃ vakra ādyā khaḍga
translated: Bhairava Shashini Shakti Vyoma Ishvari Avva Papau Aim. Kivam Vakra and others, Khadga

original: bhairava bhūtavallabhāśakti vyomeśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ //
analyzed: bhairava bhūta vallabha āśakti vyomeśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ
translated: Bhairava Bhuta Vallabha Shakti Vyoma Ishvari Avva Papau Aim.

analyzed: p  niśam keśa bhairava duḥkhāntakī śakti vyomeśvarī
translated: P.🔽Nishum Shambara and others, Avaka Bhairava, Duhkhantaki Shakti Vyoma Ishvari Avva

original: pāpū aiṃ // viṣaṃ ṣaṭkādyā śveta bhairava duritāṃtakī śakti vyomeśvarī avvā
analyzed: aiṃ viṣam ṣaṭka ādyā śveta bhairava duritāntakī śakti vyomeśvarī
translated: Papau Aim. Vishum Shatka and others, Shveta Bhairava, Duritantaki Shakti Vyoma Ishvari Avva

original: pāpū aiṃ // ccesaṃ sarvādyā bhṛgu bhairava prasannā śakti vyomeśvarī avvā🔽pāpū aiṃ // ḷṃ haṃsavyomeśvarī cakravyomeśvarī cakrādyanātha lakulīśa
analyzed: aim sarva ādyā bhṛgu bhairava prasannā śakti vyomeśvarī  pāpū aiṃ ḷṃ haṃsa vyomeśvarī cakra vyomeśvarī cakra ādyanātha lakulīśa
translated: Papau Aim. Chhesum Sarva and others, Bhrigu Bhairava, Prasanna Shakti Vyoma Ishvari Avva🔽Papau Aim. Lam Hamsa Vyoma Ishvari, Chakra Vyoma Ishvari, Chakra Adya Natha, Lakuli Sha

original: bhairava pralayāvali śakti vyomeśvarī avvā pāpū // hsakṣmalvaryūṃ kṣaṃ
analyzed: bhairava pralayāvali śakti vyomeśvarī avvā pāpū hsakṣmalvaryūṃ kṣaṃ
translated: Bhairava, Pralaya Vali Shakti Vyoma Ishvari Avva Papau. Hsakshmalvaryaum Ksha

original: pralayāvalyādyā saṃvarta bhairava bhaya śṛṃgāra caturavīreśvarī devī
translated: The goddess who is the mistress of the heroes, skilled in love, the destroyer of the fear of the Bhairava of destruction, the mistress of the sky, the venerable lady.

original: vyomeśvarī avvā pāpū //
analyzed: vyomeśvarī avvā pāpū
translated: O Mistress of the Sky, Pāpū!

original: iti vyomeśi cakrākhyamānaṃdacakraṃ ṣoḍaśāṃte pūjyam //
analyzed: iti vyomeśi cakra ākhyam ānandacakram ṣoḍaśāṃte pūjyam
translated: Thus, the wheel called the Mistress of the Sky, the wheel of bliss, should be worshipped at the end of the sixteenth.

original: aiṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ khphreṃ hsūṃ bhagavati aṃve /
analyzed: aim hrīṃ śrīṃ khphreṃ   bhagavati
translated: Aiṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ kṣhphreṃ hṣūṃ, O Blessed One, Anve.

original: hsa khphreṃ / śrīkubjike /
analyzed: hsa khphreṃ śrī kubjike
translated: Hṣa kṣhphreṃ, O Śrī Kubjikā.

original: hsrāṃ hsrīṃ hsraṃ / ṅa ña ṇa na me / aghorāmukhi /
analyzed: hsrāṃ hsrīṃ hsraṃ ṅa ña ṇa na me aghorā mukhi
translated: Hsrāṃ hsrīṃ hsrūṃ, Ṇa ña ṇa na me, O Aghoṣāmukhī.

original: chāṃ chīṃ kinikini vicce hsrūṃ khphreṃ śrīṃ hrīṃ aiṃ // śrī kubjikāyī
analyzed: chāṃ chīṃ kinikini vicce
translated: Chāṃ chīṃ kininiki, O Vici, hsrūṃ kṣhphreṃ śrīṃ hrīṃ aiṃ, O Śrī Kubjikā.

original: maṃtrājñā śrīnātha kubja caṃdraśekhara śrīkujeśī avvā pādukāṃ pūjayāmi
analyzed: maṃtra ājñā śrīnātha kubja caṃdraśekhara śrī kuja īśī pādukām pūjayāmi
translated: The Command of the Mantra, Śrīnātha, Kubja, Candraśekhara, Śrī Kujeshi, O Avvā, I worship the sandals.

original: aiṃ śakṣmalvaryūṃ īṃ / // mūlavidyā //
analyzed: aim śakṣmalvaryūm īṃ mūlavidyā
translated: Aiṃ śakṣmalvarya ūṃ, īṃ, the root Vidyā.

original: p /
analyzed: p

original: hsrūṃ bhagavati aṃve śrīparādevī paramakalāyai śrīmūrddhni vaktrāya śrī
analyzed: bhagavati   śrī parā devī parama kalāyai śrī mūrddhni vaktrāya śrī
translated: Hsrūṃ, O Blessed One, Anve, to the head of Śrī, to the face of Śrī, to the supreme power of Śrīparādevī.

original: anādinātha pāpū hsrūṃ // hsrūṃ khphreṃ śrīkubjike śrīkulamālinī devī
analyzed: anādinātha pāpū
translated: O Anādinātha, Pāpū, hsrūṃ. Hsrūṃ kṣhphreṃ, to Śrī Kubjikā, to the goddess Śrī Kulmālinī.

original: śrīsamayāyai śrī ūrddhvavaktrāya śrī amoghanātha pāpū hsrūṃ // khphreṃ
analyzed: śrī samayāyai śrī ūrddhvavaktrāya śrī amoghanātha pāpū
translated: To Śrī Samāyā, to the upper face of Śrī, to Amoghanātha, Pāpū, hsrūṃ. Kṣhphreṃ.

original: hsrāṃ hsrīṃ hsrūṃ śrīsiddhayogeśvarī devī mudrāyai śrīpūrvavaktrāya
analyzed: hsrāṃ hsrīṃ hsrūṃ śrī siddhayogeśvarī devī mudrāyai śrī pūrva vaktrāya
translated: Hsrām hsrīm hsrūṃ to the goddess Śrī Siddhayogeśvarī, to the mudrā, to the glorious eastern face,

original: śrīśilāśekharanātha pāpū khphreṃ // śrīṃ ṅa ña ṇa na me aghorāmukhi🔽śrīmahākālī devī śrīvidyāyai śrīdakṣiṇavaktrāya śrīśaktinātha pāpū śrīṃ //
analyzed: śrī śilā śekhara nātha pāpū khphreṃ śrīṃ ṅa ña ṇa na me aghorā mukhi  śrī mahākālī devī śrīvidyāyai śrī dakṣiṇa vaktrāya śrī śakti nātha pāpū śrīṃ
translated: Śrī Śilāśekhara-nātha, Pāpū, Kḥphrem. Śrīṃ Ṅ Ṇ Ṇ N Me Aghorāmukhi,🔽to the goddess Śrī Mahākālī, to Śrī Vidyā, to the glorious southern face, to Śrī Śaktinātha, Pāpū, Śrīṃ.

original: hrīṃ chāṃ chīṃ śrīmahālakṣmī devī śrīmaṃtrāyai śrī uttaravaktrāya
analyzed: hrīṃ chāṃ chīṃ śrī mahālakṣmī devī śrīmaṃtrāyai śrī uttara vaktrāya
translated: Hrīṃ Chāṃ Chīṃ to the glorious Mahālakṣmī Devī, to Śrī Mantra, to the glorious northern face,

original: śrījyotinātha pāpū hrīṃ // aiṃ kini kini vicce śrī umā devī śrī ājñāyai
analyzed: śrī jyotinātha pāpū hrīṃ    aim kini kini vicce śrī umā devī śrī ājñāyai
translated: to Śrī Jyotirnātha, Pāpū, Hrīṃ. Aiṃ Ki Ni Ki Ni Vicce to the glorious Umā Devī, to the Ājñā,

original: śrīpaścimavaktrāya śrīvya vyāpakanātha pāpū aiṃ // iti vaktra ṣaṭkaṃ //
analyzed: śrī paścima vaktrāya śrī vya vyāpaka nātha pāpū aiṃ iti vaktra ṣaṭkam
translated: to the glorious western face, to Śrī Vyāpaka-nātha, Pāpū, Aiṃ. Thus the group of six faces.

original: aiṃ bhagavati aṃve śrīhṛtkamalāyai hṛdayā /
analyzed: aim bhagavati aṃve śrī hṛd kamalāyai hṛdayā
translated: Aiṃ O Goddess, to the Śrī Hṛt-kamalā, to the heart,

original: śirase śrīvyomānaṃdanātha pāpū hrīṃ // śrīṃ hsrāṃ hsrīṃ hsrūṃ śrī
analyzed: śirase śrī vyomānandanātha pāpū hrīṃ śrīṃ
translated: to the head, to Śrī Vyomananda-nātha, Pāpū, Hrīṃ. Śrīṃ Hsrām Hsrīm Hsrūṃ Śrī

original: p / 🔽śikhāyai śrī udayānaṃdanātha pāpū śrīṃ // khphreṃ ṅa ña ṇa name
analyzed: p  śikhāyai śrī udayānanda nātha pāpū śrīṃ    khphreṃ ṅa ña ṇa name
translated: P.🔽to the tuft, to Śrī Udayānanda-nātha, Pāpū, Śrīṃ. Kḥphrem Ṅ Ṇ Ṇ N Me

original: aghorāmukhi śrīvahurūpāyai kavacāya śrīvimalānaṃdanātha pāpū // hsrūṃ
analyzed: aghorā mukhi śrī vahurūpāyai kavacāya śrī vimalānandanātha pāpū
translated: Aghorāmukhi, to the Śrī Va-hurūpā, to the armor, to Śrī Vimalānanda-nātha, Pāpū. Hsrūṃ

original: chāṃ chīṃ śrīmahāṃtārikāyai netratrayāya śrī amṛtānaṃdanātha pāpū
analyzed: chāṃ chīṃ śrī mahāṃtārikāyai netratrayāya śrī amṛtānandanātha pāpū
translated: Chham Chhim to the three eyes of Shri Mahaantarika, Shri Amritananda Natha P.

original: hsrūṃ // hsrūṃ kini kini vicce śrīkuṃkaṇāthāyai astrāya śrīviṃdunātha pāpū
translated: Hsrum Hsrum to the weapon of Shri Kunkana Natha, Shri Vinduna Natha P.

original: hsrūṃ // iti aṃga ṣaṭkaṃ // asyā vidyāyā vyāptiḥ kathyate //
analyzed: iti aṃga ṣaṭkam asyāḥ vidyāyāḥ vyāptiḥ kathyate
translated: Hsrum Thus the six limbs. The pervasion of this Vidya is described.

original: śrīkaulinyuvāca //
analyzed: śrī kaulinī uvāca
translated: Shri Kaulin Yuvach

original: yā sā parā parā vidyā trisvarūpātmikā śubhā /
analyzed: yā sā parā parā vidyā tri svarūpa ātmikā śubhā
translated: That supreme Vidya, which is of the nature of three forms and auspicious,

original: ahaṃ sā rudraśaktirvaidvā triṃ vyākṣarikā bhavet //
analyzed: aham sā rudra śaktiḥ vaidvā trim vyākṣarikā bhavet
translated: I am that Rudra Shakti, or it may be of three aksharas.

original: sā sūkṣmā sā bhavet sthūlā sā raudrī triprakārakā /
analyzed: sā sūkṣmā sā bhavet sthūlā sā raudrī tri prakārakā
translated: She is subtle, she becomes gross, she is Raudri of three kinds.

original: asyāḥ smaraṇamātreṇa kaṃpate dehapaṃjaraṃ //
analyzed: asyāḥ smaraṇa mātreṇa kaṃpate deha paṃjaram
translated: By merely remembering her, the cage of the body shakes.

original: na cāsyāḥ sadṛśī vidyā na cāsyāḥ sadṛśaṃ kramaṃ /
analyzed: na ca asyāḥ sadṛśī vidyā na ca asyāḥ sadṛśam kramam
translated: And there is no Vidya like her, no Krama like her,

original: na cāsyāḥ sadṛśī māyā na cāsyāḥ sadṛśaṃ kulaṃ //
analyzed: na ca asyāḥ sadṛśī māyā na ca asyāḥ sadṛśam kulam
translated: No Maya like her, no Kula like her.

original: asyā bhedaṃ punarvakṣye maṃtro dvārasya dhīmata /
analyzed: asyāḥ bhedam punar vakṣye maṃtraḥ dvārasya dhīmata
translated: I will again tell the distinction of her, the Mantra of the wise door,

original: paṃcādau paścimāḥ paṃca praṇavāśca varānana //
analyzed: paṃca ādau paścimāḥ paṃca praṇavāḥ ca varānana
translated: The five in the beginning, the five in the west, and the Pranavas, O best-faced.

original: teṣāṃ madhyagatā vidyā saṃpuṭena nirodhitā /🔽himavaṃtasya piṃḍasya ādigarbha sthitasya ca //
analyzed: teṣām madhya gatā vidyā saṃpuṭena nirodhitā  himavaṃtasya piṃḍasya ādigarbha sthitasya ca
translated: The Vidya located in the middle of them is obstructed by the Samputa,

original: p /
analyzed: p
translated: Of the mass of the Himalayas, and of that which is situated in the beginning of the womb,

original: tasyā rephanirodhena tatra sā vāruṇī kalā /
analyzed: tasyāḥ repha nirodhena tatra sā vāruṇī kalā
translated: By the obstruction of the letter ra in that (syllable), that is the energy of Varuna there.

original: etatkaraṇavidyāyā pūrṇimā sā prakāśitā //
analyzed: etad karaṇa vidyāyāḥ pūrṇimā sā prakāśitā
translated: That is the full moon of the knowledge of the instrument, revealed.

original: tatsthamārādhayed vidyāmanyathā sā parāṅmukhī /
analyzed: tad stham ārādhayet vidyām anyathā sā parāṅmukhī
translated: One should worship the knowledge located there, otherwise it turns away.

original: bhagavati padamādau kaulinī prakṛtirbhavet //
analyzed: bhagavati padam ādau kaulinī prakṛtiḥ bhavet
translated: O Goddess, at the beginning, the state should be Kaulini, the nature.

original: śirastu mālinī vījamamṛtaṃ hṛdi paṃkajaṃ /
analyzed: śiraḥ tu mālinī vījam amṛtam hṛdi paṃkajam
translated: The head is Malini, the seed of nectar, the lotus in the heart.

original: caṃdrādityau visargaśca stanayobho varārcita //
analyzed: caṃdra ādityau visargaḥ ca vara arcita
translated: The sun and moon, the emission, are the two breasts, O best worshipped.

original: khecaraṃ ṣaḍvidhaṃ madhye ṣaṭpīṭheṣu adhiṣṭhitaṃ /
analyzed: khecaram ṣaḍvidham madhye ṣaṣ pīṭheṣu adhiṣṭhitam
translated: The sixfold sky-goer is established in the six sacred seats in the middle.

original: uḍḍiyānaṃ hasakāmākhyaṃ khaphau kuṃkaṇa pūrṇakau //
analyzed: uḍḍiyānam hasa kāma ākhyam khaphau kuṃkaṇa pūrṇakau
translated: Uḍḍiyāna, Ha, Sa, and Kāma, Kha and Pha, Kuṅkaṇa and Pūrṇaka.

original: rephaṃ jālaṃdharaṃ pīṭhaṃ yatra sā kaulinī vaset /
analyzed: repham jālaṃdharam pīṭham yatra sā kaulinī vaset
translated: The letter ra is the sacred seat of Jālandhara, where that Kaulini resides.

original: tisraḥ srotastrikoṇāyāmetat ṣaḍavidha khecaraṃ //
analyzed: tisraḥ srotaḥ trikoṇāyām etat ṣaḍavidha khecaram
translated: The three currents in the triangle, this is the sixfold sky-goer.

original: vidyāḥ saptamadhiṣṭhānaṃ sa cātmā kaulikī bhavet /
analyzed: vidyāḥ saptam adhiṣṭhānam sa ca ātmā kaulikī bhavet
translated: The seven knowledges are the foundation, and that Self would be Kaulini.

original: payo madhye yathā sarpirgrahāṇāṃ ca yathā śaśī /
analyzed: payaḥ madhye yathā sarpiḥ grahāṇām ca yathā śaśī
translated: Just as ghee is in the middle of milk, and the moon among the planets,

original: nāgānāṃ takṣako yadvat tathāsau khecaraḥ śivaḥ //
analyzed: nāgānām takṣakaḥ yadvat tathā asau khecaraḥ śivaḥ
translated: just as Takṣaka among the serpents, so is that sky-goer Śiva.

original: na cāsyāḥ sadṛśo maṃtro maṃtrakoṭi śatairapi /
analyzed: na ca asyāḥ sadṛśaḥ maṃtraḥ maṃtra koṭi śataiḥ api
translated: And there is no mantra equal to this, even with hundreds of millions of mantras.

original: asyā smaraṇamātreṇa kuṣmāvasthā pravartate //
analyzed: asyāḥ smaraṇa mātreṇa kuṣma avasthā pravartate
translated: Merely by remembering her, the state of Kumbhaka arises.

original: śrīnāma kubjikāyonirvidyā jihvā prabhedataḥ /
analyzed: śrī nāma kubjikā yoniḥ vidyā jihvā prabhedataḥ
translated: The name of the venerable Kubjika, the source of knowledge, is the tongue, divided by the phonemes.

original: anunāsairbhavennāsā maṇipūrekaraṃdhrake //🔽p /
analyzed: anunāsaiḥ bhavet nāsā maṇipūra ikaraṃdhrake  p
translated: The nose is with the nasal sounds, in the single hole of the navel.

original: chāṃ chīṃ śabdadvayaṃ netre kini kini devatā //
analyzed: chāṃ chīṃ śabda dvayam netre kini kini devatā
translated: The two sounds chhaṃ and chhiṃ are the eyes, kini kini is the deity.

original: vicce sarvāṃga rudhira metanmaṃtropadeśakaṃ /
analyzed: vicce sarva aṃga rudhira metat maṃtra upadeśakam
translated: Vicche is the blood of the entire body, this is the teaching of the mantra.

original: padabheda kramācchaṃbho jñātvā kṣobhaḥ pravartate //
analyzed: pada bheda kramāt śaṃbho jñātvā kṣobhaḥ pravartate
translated: O Śambhu, by knowing the division of the parts in order, arousal occurs.

original: yo yoginī kule jāto yeṣāṃ tuṣṭāsmyahaṃ śiva /
analyzed: yaḥ kule jātaḥ yeṣām tuṣṭā asmi aham śiva
translated: O Śiva, those in whose family the Yoginīs are born, and I am pleased with them,

original: te labhaṃte kramodvāraṃ kaumāraṃ durati kramaṃ //
analyzed: te labhaṃte krama udvāram kaumāram durati kramam
translated: they obtain the door of the Krama, the Kaula, the difficult to attain Krama.

original: eṣā prakṛti rasmākaṃ brahmāṃḍorddhamapaṃcakaṃ /
analyzed: eṣā prakṛtiḥ
translated: This is our nature, the five above the universe.

original: pātāle paṃcadhā bhedastrigatistripathāśramaṃ //
analyzed: pātāle paṃcadhā bhedaḥ tri gatiḥ tri patha āśramam
translated: There are five divisions in the netherworld, the path of three goes to the hermitage of three paths.

original: eṣa vai mūlamaṃtrasya upodghāto varānana //🔽anantaraṃ divyadivyādivyasiddhamānava adhikāra śiṣyoghakrameṇa
analyzed: eṣa vai mūlamaṃtrasya upodghātaḥ varānana  anantaram divya divya adivya siddha mānava adhikāra śiṣya ugha krameṇa
translated: This is the introduction to the root mantra, O best of faces.

original: guruśuddhirllikhyate //
analyzed: guru śuddhiḥ likhyate
translated: After that, the purification of the guru is written in the order of the stream of disciples who have authority as divine, more divine, half divine, accomplished, and human.

original: hsrūṃ śrīśaṃbhunāthādhikāre śrīkulakaulī siddhājñā hsakhphreṃ / śrī
analyzed: śrī śaṃbhunātha adhikāre śrī kula kaulī siddhājñā
translated: Hsrūṃ, in the authority of Śrī Śambhunātha, the accomplished command of the venerable Kulakaulikā, HSKHPHREM. Śrī

original: unmanāyai śrī krauṃcikājñāvalī avvā / śakṣmalvaryūṃ / śrīsadya deva
analyzed: unmanāyai śrī krauṃcikā ājñā āvalī avvā  śrī sadya deva
translated: To the venerable Sadyodeva,

original: śrītūṣṇīśanātha pāpū aiṃ // hsrūṃ śrīmerunāthādhikāre khphreṃ🔽śrīmahākālī kulājñā // hsakhphreṃ śrīmanonmanāyai śrīvakrājñāvalī avvā /
analyzed: śrī tūṣṇīśa nātha pāpū aim   śrī merunātha adhikāre khphreṃ
translated: To the venerable Lord of Speech, Pāpū, Aiṃ. Hsrūṃ, to the authority of the venerable Merunātha, Kṣhphreṃ.🔽The Kula Command of the venerable Mahākālī. Hskṣhphreṃ, to the venerable Manonmanā, the garland of the Command of the venerable Vakrā, the Mother.

original: śakṣmalvaryūṃ / śrīciṃciṇīnātha śrīśrīnātha pāpū aiṃ //🔽p /
analyzed: śakṣmal varyūṃ śrī ciṃciṇī nātha śrī śrī nātha pāpū aiṃ  p
translated: To the venerable Ciñciņīnātha, the venerable Śrīnātha, Pāpū, Aiṃ.

original: hsrūṃ aṃ śrī ātmatatvādhikāre phreṃ śrīkālikāle guru ājñā hsakhphreṃ
analyzed: aṃ śrī ātma tatva adhikāre phreṃ śrī kālikāle guru ājñā
translated: Hsrūṃ, to the authority of the Ātmatattva, Phreṃ. The Command of the Guru, Kālikā, Hskṣhphreṃ.

original: śrīsamanāyai śrīkubjikājñāvalī avvā / śakṣmalvaryūṃ śrī uṃḍḍrīśanātha
analyzed: śrī samanāyai śrī kubjikā ājñā āvalī śrī uṃḍḍrīśa nātha
translated: To the venerable Samanā, the garland of the Command of the venerable Kubjikā, the Mother.

original: pāpū aiṃ // iti śāṃbhavantrikaṃ //
analyzed: aim iti śāṃbhavantrikam
translated: To the venerable Uḍḍīśa, the Lord, Pāpū, Aiṃ. Thus, the triad of Śambhu.

original: divyoghaḥ //🔽śrī unmattānaṃdanātha hsrūṃ śrī unmattā devī avvā hsakhphreṃ / śrīparā devī
analyzed: divi oghaḥ  śrī unmattānandanātha   śrī unmattā devī
translated: The Divine Current.🔽To the venerable Urmatanānātha, Hsrūṃ, to the venerable Urmatā Devī, the Mother, Hskṣhphreṃ. To the venerable Parā Devī,

original: parā pāpū aiṃ // śrīsamanānaṃdanātha hsrūṃ śrīsamanādevī avvā /
analyzed: parā aim śrī samanā nandanātha   śrī samanā devī
translated: Parā, Pāpū, Aiṃ. To the venerable Samanānātha, Hsrūṃ, to the venerable Samanā Devī, the Mother.

original: hsakhphreṃ śrīkaulinī devī parā pāpū aiṃ // śrīvyāpinyānaṃdanātha hsrūṃ
analyzed: hsakhphreṃ śrī kaulinī devī parā pāpū aiṃ śrī vyāpinī ānandanātha
translated: Hskṣhphreṃ, to the venerable Kaulinī Devī, Parā, Pāpū, Aiṃ. To the venerable Vyāpinānātha, Hsrūṃ.

original: śrīvyāpinī devī avvā // hsakhphreṃ / śrīvyāpni devī parā pāpū aiṃ // śrī🔽avyaktānaṃdanātha hsrūṃ śrī avyaktā devī avvā / hsakhphreṃ / śrīśāṃbhavā
analyzed: śrī vyāpinī devī avvā  devī parā aiṃ śrī  avyaktānandanātha   śrī avyaktā devī
translated: The venerable Vyāpinī Goddess is Avvā. HSKHPHREM. The venerable Vyāpinī Goddess is Parā Pāpū AIM. The venerable Avyakta Ānandanātha HSRŪM. The venerable Avyaktā Goddess is Avvā. HSKHPHREM. The venerable Śāmbhavā

original: devī parā pāpū aiṃ // śrīnaṃdinyānaṃdanātha hsrūṃ śrīnaṃdinī devī avvā /
analyzed: devī parā aiṃ śrī naṃdinī ānandanātha   śrī naṃdinī devī
translated: Goddess is Parā Chāṣaya OM. The venerable Nandinyānandanātha HSRŪM. The venerable Nandini Goddess is Avvā.

original: hsakhphreṃ śrīṣaṣṭhādevī parā cāṣayoṃ / //
analyzed: śrī ṣaṣṭhā devī parā cāṣa yoṃ
translated: HSKHPHREM. The venerable Ṣaṣṭhā Goddess is Parā Chāṣaya OM.

original: śrīmaṃthānānaṃdanātha hsrūṃ śrīmaṃthānādevī avvā / hsakhphreṃ
analyzed: śrī maṃthānā nandanātha   śrī maṃthānā devī
translated: The venerable Maṃthānānandanātha HSRŪM. The venerable Maṃthānā Goddess is Avvā. HSKHPHREM

original: śrīcakradevī parā pāpū aiṃ // śrīherukānaṃdanātha hsrūṃ śrīheru 🔽p / 🔽hsakhphreṃ śrīsiddhādevī parā pāpū aiṃ // śrīsamayākhyanaṃdanātha hsrūṃ
analyzed: śrī cakra devī parā aiṃ śrī herukānandanātha   śrī heru  p  śrī siddhā devī parā pāpū aiṃ śrī samaya ākhya nandanātha
translated: The venerable Cakradevi is Parā Pāpū AIM. The venerable Herukānandanātha HSRŪM. The venerable Heru🔽Goddess is Avvā. HSKHPHREM. The venerable Siddha Goddess is Parā Pāpū AIM. The venerable Samyākhyānandanātha HSRŪM

original: śrīsamayākhyādevī avvā / hsakhphreṃ śrīnayādevī / parā pāpū aiṃ //
analyzed: śrī samaya ākhyā devī avvā  hsakhphreṃ śrī nayādevī parā pāpū aiṃ
translated: The venerable Samyākhyā Goddess is Avvā. HSKHPHREM. The venerable Nayā Goddess is Parā Chāṣaya OM.

original: śrījṛṃbhānaṃdanātha hsrūṃ śrījṛṃbhāde avvā / hsakhphreṃ śrī aparādevī
analyzed: śrī jṛṃbha ānanda nātha   śrī jṛṃbhāde avvā śrī aparā devī
translated: The venerable Jṛmbhanānandanātha HSRŪM. The venerable Jṛmbhadā Goddess is Avvā. HSKHPHREM. The venerable Aparā Goddess

original: parā pāpū aiṃ // śrīkālasaṃkarṣaṇānaṃdanātha hsrūṃ śrīkālasaṃkarṣaṇī
analyzed: parā pāpū aim śrī kāla saṃkarṣaṇa ānandanātha   śrī kāla saṃkarṣaṇī
translated: is Parā Chāṣaya OM. The venerable Kālasaṃkarṣaṇānandanātha HSRŪM. The venerable Kālasaṃkarṣiṇī🔽Goddess is Avvā. HSKHPHREM. The venerable Kālikā Goddess is Parā Chāṣaya OM.

original: devī avvā / hsakhphreṃ śrīsūryādevī parā pāpū aiṃ // śrīcaṃḍānaṃdanātha
analyzed: devī avvā hsakhphreṃ śrī sūryādevī parā pāpū aiṃ śrī caṃḍānandanātha
translated: Goddess Avva. HSKHPHREM Shri Suryadevi Para Papa Poop AIM. Shri Chandananda Nath

original: hsrūṃ śrīcaṃḍādevī avvā / hsakhphreṃ śrīnirṇayādevī parā pāpū aiṃ // śrī
analyzed: hsrūṃ śrī caṃḍā devī avvā  śrī nirṇayā devī parā pāpū aiṃ śrī
translated: HSROOM Shri Chandadevi Avva. HSKHPHREM Shri Nirnayadevi Para Papa Poop AIM. Shri

original: aghoreśānaṃdanātha hsrū śrī aghoreśī devī avvā / hsakhphreṃ śrīśāṃtādevī🔽parā pāpū aiṃ // śrī trailokyānaṃdanātha hsrūṃ śrītrailokyā devī avvā /
analyzed: aghora īśa ānandanātha hsrū śrī aghoreśī devī avvā  hsakhphreṃ śrī śāṃtā devī  parā pāpū aiṃ śrī trailokyānandanātha hsrūṃ śrī trailokyā devī

original: bharaṇeśvarī / śrīśaṃvareśanātha pāpū // munīṃdra prabhā🔽mukhakauleśvarī kāmākhya pīṭha kusumā avājñā khphreṃ bhairavākhya devī
analyzed: mukha kauleśvarī kāmākhya pīṭha kusumā avājñā khphreṃ bhairava ākhya devī
translated: The radiance of the lord of sages.🔽The face of the mistress of Kaulīs, the seat called Kāma, the flower, the command of the goddess called Bhairava, KHPHREM.

original: kāmākhya cakra kālikādyā śrīmitreśanātha pāpū aiṃ // trisra prabhā
analyzed: kāmākhya cakra kālikā ādyā śrīmitreśanātha pāpū aiṃ trisra prabhā
translated: The wheel called Kāma, the venerable Mitreśa-nātha, the first of the Kalika-ādyās, Pāpū, EIM. The radiance of the three.

original: tribhuvaneśa tribhuvanāvvā
analyzed: tribhuvana īśa tribhuvanau vā
translated: Lord of the three worlds, light of the three worlds,

original: p / 🔽madanājñā hsrūṃ śrītripurākhya devī tryasra cakrākhyā tilottama devī🔽śrīmitreśanātha pāpū aiṃ // kulaprabhā kuleśvarī viṃdu kubjikājñā hsūḥ
analyzed: p  madana ājñā hsrūṃ śrī tripura ākhya devī tri asra cakra ākhyā tilottama devī
translated: Om.🔽Goddess of the three cities, goddess of the three corners, goddess of the three eyes, goddess of the three worlds,🔽Om.

original: śrīkumudeśvarī ciccakra viccāvvā śrīkauleśanātha pāpū aiṃ // iti pīṭhaṣaṭkam🔽prathama ṣaṭkam ādhārādicakraṣaṭke pūjyam //
translated: Mistress of the three worlds, goddess of the three worlds, goddess of the three eyes, goddess of the three worlds,🔽Om.🔽Goddess of the three worlds, goddess of the three worlds, goddess of the three eyes, goddess of the three worlds,🔽Om.

original: vahiḥ pūrvakoṇādi īśānakoṇāṃtaṃ //🔽ghasmara carcikā vicceśvarī śrīviccāvvā pāpū aiṃ // svarūpavāhinī🔽navasthānagā śrīnaṃdinī viccāvvā pāpū aiṃ // padmaśobhā vikāśinī viccāvvā
analyzed: vahis pūrva koṇa ādi īśāna koṇa aṃtam                                                       nava sthāna gā śrī naṃdinī viccāvvā pāpū aim padmaśobhā vikāśinī viccāvvā
translated: The first set of six is to be worshipped in the six cakras starting from the base.

original: pāpū // mahāśāṃtāvikaśvara vikāśinī viccāvvā pāpū aiṃ // nādacarcikā🔽śabdādyā śrīṣaṭkaviccāvvā pāpū aiṃ // siddhāṃga paṃcakam
analyzed: śabda ādyā śrī ṣaṭka viccāvvā pāpū aiṃ siddhāṃga paṃcakam
translated: Outside, from the east corner to the northeast corner.🔽Om.

original: svādhiṣṭānādvimvāṃta pūjyaṃ / vahirmadhya ṣaḍasre īśa āgneya agratālo
analyzed: pūjyam vahis madhya ṣaṣ asre īśaḥ āgneya
translated: The second set of six is to be worshipped in the six cakras starting from the navel. Outside, in the middle six-sided figure, from the northeast to the southeast corner.

original: sveṣṭadho mukhe tryasre pūjyam // bhagavati aṃve hṛtkamalāyī hṛdayāya
analyzed: sva iṣṭa adhas mukhe tri asre pūjyam bhagavati hṛd kamalāyī hṛdayāya
translated: In one's own desired mouth, the three-peaked one should be worshipped.🔽O Goddess, in the heart lotus, the heart.🔽O Lord of the knowledge of bliss, in the belly of the heart, the goddess.

original: vidyānaṃdanātha hṛdayodara devī śrīyonimudrāyī avvā pāpū aiṃ //
analyzed: vidyānandanātha hṛdaya udara devī śrī yonimudrā āyī avvā pāpū aiṃ
translated: O bearer of the Yoni mudra, the woman.

original: śrīkubjike kuladīpā īśirasi
translated: O Kubjika, the lamp of Kula, on the head of Ishvara.

original: p / 🔽śrīvyāpakanātha śrīśikhaṃḍadevī śrīsiṃhamudrā ī avvā pāpū aiṃ // hsrāṃ
analyzed: p  śrī vyāpaka nātha śrī śikhaṃḍa devī śrī siṃha mudrā ī avvā pāpū aiṃ
translated: P.🔽O all-pervading Lord, O goddess with a beautiful tail, the lion mudra.🔽The woman.🔽Hsrām Hsrīm Hsrām, O bearer of beautiful hair, on the crest.

original: hsrīṃ hsraṃ śrīvarvarakeśā īśikhāyai śrīvimalanātha śrīśilāśekhara devī
analyzed: hsrīṃ hsraṃ śrī varvara keśāḥ īśikhāyai śrī vimalanātha śrī śilā śekhara devī
translated: O Vimalanatha, the goddess with a rocky crest.🔽The mudra of the messenger.🔽The woman.

original: śrīdūti mudrā ī avvā pāpū aiṃ // ṅa ña ṇa name aghorāmukhi vahurūpā ī
analyzed: śrī dūti mudrā ī aiṃ name aghorā mukhi vahurūpā
translated: O Aghoramukhi, O bearer of many forms, on the armor.🔽O Udayanatha, the skull.🔽The goddess Shankhini, the mudra.

original: kavacāya śrī udayanātha kapālaṃ devī śrīśaṃkhinī mudrā ī avvā pāpū aiṃ //
analyzed: kavacāya śrī udayanātha kapālam devī śrī śaṃkhinī mudrā aiṃ
translated: The woman.🔽Chām Chhīm, O Mahantarika, on the three eyes.🔽O Amritanatha, the fierce goddess.

original: chāṃ cchīṃ mahaṃtārikā ī netratrayāya amṛtanātha śrīcaṃḍikā avvā devī
analyzed: chāṃ cchīṃ mahaṃtārikā netratrayāya amṛtanātha śrīcaṃḍikā devī
translated: The woman.🔽The mudra of Kula.🔽The woman.

original: kulamudrā ī avvā pāpū aiṃ // kini kini vicce śrīkukaṇā ī astrāya śrīviṃdunātha
analyzed: kulamudrā ī avvā pāpū aim kini kini vicce śrī kukaṇā ī astrāya śrī vindunātha
translated: Kinini, O Kubjana, on the weapon.🔽O Vindunanatha, the goddess without vowels.🔽The vajra mudra.

original: anacka devī śrīvajramudrā ī avvā pāpū aiṃ // ādhāra svādhiṣṭhāna maṇipūra
analyzed: anacka devī śrī vajramudrā ī avvā pāpū aiṃ ādhāra svādhiṣṭhāna maṇipūra
translated: The woman.

original: anāhata viśuddhi brahmaraṃdhra sthāneṣu pūjyam / vāhya agranaiṛtya
analyzed: anāhata viśuddhi brahmaraṃdhra sthāneṣu pūjyam vāhya agranaiṛtya
translated: In the unstruck, pure, and brahma-randhra places, the external, beginning with the southwest,🔽southeast, northwest, west, and ending with the northeast,

original: āgneya vāyavya paścima īśānāṃtaṃ // ḍāṃ ḍīṃ ḍūṃ ḍaiṃ ḍauṃ ḍaḥ
analyzed: āgneya vāyavya paścima īśāna aṃtam ḍāṃ ḍīṃ ḍūṃ ḍaiṃ ḍauṃ ḍaḥ
translated: ḍāṃ ḍīṃ ḍūṃ ḍaiṃ ḍauṃ ḍaḥ🔽śrīḍāmarī avvā pāpū aiṃ

original: śrīḍāmarī avvā pāpū aiṃ // rāṃ śrītraiśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ // lāṃ
analyzed: śrī ḍāmarī avvā pāpū aiṃ rāṃ śrī traiśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ   lāṃ
translated: rāṃ śrī traisvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ🔽lāṃ🔽śrī lambakarṇī avvā pāpū aiṃ

original: śrīlaṃvakarṇī avvā pāpū aiṃ // kāṃ śrīkarṇakubjikā avvā pāpū aiṃ // sāṃ
analyzed: śrī laṃvakarṇī avvā pāpū aiṃ  kāṃ śrī karṇa kubjikā avvā pāpū aiṃ    sāṃ
translated: kāṃ śrī karṇakubjikā avvā pāpū aiṃ🔽sāṃ

original: śrīsarvasuṃdarī avvā pāpū aiṃ //
analyzed: śrī sarva suṃdarī avvā pāpū aiṃ
translated: śrī sarvasundarī avvā pāpū aiṃ

original: p /
analyzed: p
translated: p.🔽haṃ śrī haṃsākhyā avvā pāpū aiṃ

original: haṃ śrīhaṃsākhyā avvā pāpū aiṃ // yāṃ śrīyākinī avvā pāpū aiṃ //
analyzed: haṃ śrīhaṃsa ākhyā avvā pāpū aim   yāṃ śrīyākinī avvā pāpū aim
translated: yāṃ śrī yākinī avvā pāpū aiṃ

original: ḍādiṣaṭkaṃ ādhārādi cakraṣaṭke vahiḥ pīṭha ṣaṭkakrameṇa pūjyam //
analyzed: ḍa ādi ṣaṭkam ādhāra ādi cakra ṣaṭke vahis pīṭha ṣaṭka krameṇa pūjyam
translated: The six beginning with ḍa are to be worshipped externally in the six cakras beginning with the foundation in the order of the six pīṭhas.

original: yaralava hrīṃ / heṃ hāṃ śrī ādhāracakre śrīmaṃtranātha śrīmaṃtrā avvā
analyzed: hrīṃ     śrī ādhāra cakre śrī maṃtranātha śrī maṃtrā
translated: ya ra la va hrīṃ. heṃ hāṃ śrī ādhāra cakre śrī mantra nātha śrī mantre avvā🔽pāpū aiṃ

original: pāpū aiṃ // yaralava hrīṃ / hiṃ hīṃ śrīsvādhiṣṭhānaṃ cakre śrīsakalanātha
analyzed: aim
translated: ya ra la va hrīṃ. hiṃ hīṃ śrī svādhiṣṭhāna cakre śrī sakala nātha🔽śrī sakale avvā pāpū aiṃ

original: śrīsakalā avvā pāpū aiṃ // hu hū śrīmaṇipūrakacakre śrīkoṭireṣanātha
analyzed: śrī sakalā pāpū aim hu hū śrī maṇipūraka cakre śrī koṭireṣa nātha
translated: hu hū śrī maṇipūraka cakre śrī koṭireṣa nātha

original: śrīkoṭireṣā avvā pāpū aiṃ // heṃ heṃ śrī anāhatacakre śrīraktāṃganātha🔽śrīraktāṃ avvā pāpū aiṃ // hāṃ hauṃ śrīviśuddhacakre śrīsubhaganātha
analyzed: śrī koṭiḥ eṣā avvā pāpū aim heṃ heṃ śrī anāhatacakre śrī raktāṅganātha  śrī raktām avvā pāpū aim hāṃ   śrī viśuddhacakre śrī subhaga nātha
translated: This is the crore of Shri, the mother of all, Pāpū Aiṃ. Heṃ Heṃ, in the Anahata Chakra, Shri Rakta Anganātha🔽Shri Rakta, the mother of all, Pāpū Aiṃ. Hāṃ Hūṃ, in the Vishuddha Chakra, Shri Subhaga Natha

original: śrīsubhagā avvā pāpū aiṃ // ha haḥ śrī ājñācakre śrīśaṃkaranātha
analyzed: śrī subhagā avvā pāpū aiṃ ha haḥ śrī ājñācakre śrī śaṃkara nātha
translated: Shri Subhagā, the mother of all, Pāpū Aiṃ. Ha Haḥ, in the Ājñā Chakra, Shri Shankara Natha

original: śrīśaṃkarā avvā pāpū aiṃ // cakraṣaṭkeṣaṭkaṃ prāgavat pūjanīyam // ādyā🔽vidyā śabdākhyā avvā pāpū aiṃ // sarvapuṣpeśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ // yogavicca
analyzed: vidyā śabda ākhyā avvā pāpū aiṃ sarvapuṣpā īśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ
translated: Shri Shankara, the mother of all, Pāpū Aiṃ. The six sets in the six chakras should be worshipped as before. The first🔽Vidyā is called Śabda, the mother of all, Pāpū Aiṃ. Sarvapushpeshvari, the mother of all, Pāpū Aiṃ. Yoga Viddha

original: śabdākhya vidyā avvā pāpū aiṃ // siddhavidyā cakreśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ //
translated: Śabda Akhya Vidyā, the mother of all, Pāpū Aiṃ. Siddha Vidyā Chakra Ishvari, the mother of all, Pāpū Aiṃ.

original: ātmavidyā śrīsarveśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ //🔽p / 🔽paṃcakaṃ svādhiṣṭhānādi viṃdvaṃtaṃ prāgavan madhye ūrddhvamukhe tryasre
analyzed: ātma vidyā śrī sarveśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ  p  paṃcakam svādhiṣṭhāna ādi viṃdu aṃtam prāga vat madhye ūrddhva mukhe tri asre
translated: Ātmā Vidyā Shri Sarveshwari, the mother of all, Pāpū Aiṃ.

original: pūjyam //
analyzed: pūjyam
translated: The five, starting from Svādhiṣṭhāna up to the Bindu, should be worshipped in the middle of the upward-facing triangle as before.

original: ādyakulanātha pāpū aiṃ // siddhakulanātha pāpū aiṃ // kulakalpakulanātha
analyzed: ādya kula nātha pāpū aim siddha kula nātha pāpū aim    kula kalpa kula nātha
translated: The first Kula Natha, Pāpū Aiṃ. Siddha Kula Natha, Pāpū Aiṃ. Kula Kalpa Kula Natha

original: pāpū aiṃ // paramahaṃsanātha haṃsamālinī avvā pāpū aiṃ // catuḥkaṃ
analyzed: pāpū aiṃ paramahaṃsa nātha haṃsamālinī avvā pāpū aiṃ catuḥkaṃ
translated: Pāpū Aiṃ. Paramahamsa Natha Hamsa Mālinī, the mother of all, Pāpū Aiṃ. The four

original: svādhinānāhata viṃdutadūrddha pṛṣṭhavaṃse vahiragra dakṣiṇa vāmamadhye
analyzed: vahis agra dakṣiṇa vāma madhye
translated: In the lower part, the navel, the heart, the throat, the head, the forehead, the back, the right, the left, and the middle outside,

original: pūjyam // iti dvātriṃśatkramaḥ //
analyzed: pūjyam iti dvātriṃśat kramaḥ
translated: they should be worshipped. Thus ends the thirty-second chapter.

original: tato gurvoghakramaḥ pūjyaḥ // uṃjānaṃdanātha maṃtreśī avvā uṃghājñā
analyzed: tatas guru ogha kramaḥ pūjyaḥ uṃjā nandanātha maṃtreśī uṃgha ājñā
translated: Then the Guru-Ogha Krama should be worshipped: Unjana Natha, Mantra Isha Avva, Unja Jna,

original: śrīśāṃbhārī devyā avvā pāpū aiṃ // śrījāgrānaṃdanātha śrītureśvarī avvā
analyzed: śrī śāṃbhārī devyā avvā pāpū aiṃ śrī jāgrānandanātha śrī tureśvarī
translated: Sri Shambhari Devi Avva Papa, Ai. Sri Jagrananda Natha, Sri Tureshwari Avva,

original: jaḍa pravodhājñā śrīśikhādevī avvā pāpū aiṃ // śrīpūrṇānandanātha
translated: Jada Prabodha Jna, Sri Shikha Devi Avva Papa, Ai. Sri Purnananda Natha,

original: śrīcaṃḍeśvarī avvā pūjājñā śrī avvā devī avvā pāpū aiṃ //
analyzed: śrī caṃḍeśvarī avvā pūjā ājñā śrī avvā devī avvā pāpū aiṃ
translated: Sri Chandeshwari Avva, Puja Jna, Sri Avva Devi Avva Papa, Ai.

original: śrīkāṃtānaṃdanātha śrīyogeśvarī avvā kāṃtājñā śrīśāṃtadevī avvā pāpū
analyzed: śrī kāntānaṃdanātha śrī yogeśvarī kāntājñā śrīśāṃtadevī
translated: Sri Kantananda Natha, Sri Yogeshwari Avva, Kanti Jna, Sri Shanta Devi Avva Papa,

original: aiṃ // iti pīṭhoghaṃ madhya ṣaḍasre madhya īśānyādi krameṇa vahirnādaujjhitāt
analyzed: aiṃ iti pīṭha ogham ṣaṣ asre madhye īśānī ādi krameṇa vahis nāda ojjhitāt
translated: Ai. Thus, the Peethoghas are in the middle of the six directions, starting from Isha in the outer Nadaujjhita,

original: samārabhya ādhārāṃta manukramāditi nityā kule pūjyāḥ //🔽p /
analyzed: samārabhya ādhāra aṃta manu kramāt iti nityā kule pūjyāḥ  p
translated: up to the base, in order. Thus, the eternal ones should be worshipped in the Kula.

original: śrī oḍḍunātha śrīṣaṣṭhanātha śrīmitrīśanātha śrīcaryanātha pāpū aiṃ //
analyzed: śrī oḍḍunātha śrī ṣaṣṭha nātha śrī mitrīśa nātha śrī carya nātha pāpū aiṃ
translated: Sri Odanatha, Sri Sashthanatha, Sri Mitreeshanatha, Sri Charayana Papa, Ai.

original: iti siddhoghaḥ //
analyzed: iti siddha oghaḥ
translated: Thus ends the Siddhoghas.

original: śrīkalpavṛkṣa pāpū aiṃ / śrīkadaṃvavṛkṣa pāpū aiṃ //
analyzed: śrī kalpavṛkṣa pāpū aiṃ śrī kadaṃva vṛkṣa pāpū aiṃ
translated: Sri Kalpa Tree Papau Aim. Sri Kadamba Tree Papau Aim.

original: śrīkalyāṇavṛkṣa pāpū aiṃ // śrīkamalavṛkṣa pāpū aiṃ // iti vṛkṣoghaḥ //
analyzed: śrī kalyāṇa vṛkṣa pāpū aiṃ śrī kamala vṛkṣa pāpū aiṃ iti vṛkṣa oghaḥ
translated: Sri Kalyan Tree Papau Aim. Sri Kamala Tree Papau Aim. Thus is the Tree Ogh.

original: śrīsatyānaṃdanātha śrī avvā devī avvā pāpū aiṃ // śrīmitrānaṃdanātha
analyzed: śrī satyānaṃdanātha śrī avvā devī avvā pāpū aiṃ śrī mitrānaṃdanātha
translated: Sri Satyananda Natha Sri Avva Devi Avva Papau Aim. Sri Mitrananda Natha

original: śrīpāṃḍuvavinī avvā pāpū aiṃ // śrīvadirānaṃdanātha śrīkuṃḍalā avvā
analyzed: śrī pāṃḍu vavinī avvā pāpū aiṃ śrī vadirānandanātha śrī kuṃḍalā
translated: Sri Pandu Vini Avva Papau Aim. Sri Vadirana Natha Sri Kundala Avva

original: pāpū aiṃ // śrī avvānaṃdanātha sukri vyādhā avvā pāpū aiṃ // iti samayoghaḥ //
analyzed: pāpū aim śrī avvānandanātha sukri vyādhā avvā pāpū aim iti samaya ughaḥ
translated: Papau Aim. Sri Avvana Natha Sukri Vyadha Avva Papau Aim. Thus is the Samaya Ogh.

original: brahmamadhyagaryālānaṃdanātha caṃḍaviccāvvā pāpū aiṃ // viṣṇu
translated: Brahma Madhyaga Ryalana Natha Chanda Vichcha Avva Papau Aim. Vishnu

original: madhyaga śrīvyāpti garbhānaṃdanātha svarūpānaṃdadhāriṇī śrīcaṃdrā avvā
analyzed: śrī vyāpti garbhānaṃdanātha svarūpa ānaṃda dhāriṇī śrī caṃdrā
translated: Madhyaga Sri Vyapti Garbha Natha Svarupa Ananda Dharini Sri Chandra Avva

original: kāraṇeśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ // rudra madhyaga śrīsarvānaṃdanātha pariśobhā
analyzed: kāraṇeśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ rudra madhya ga śrī sarvānandanātha pariśobhā
translated: Karana Ishvari Avva Papau Aim. Rudra Madhyaga Sri Sarva Ananda Natha Pari Shobha

original: biṃbeśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ // īśvara madhyaga śrī amarānaṃdanātha madhyagā
analyzed: biṃbeśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ īśvara madhya ga śrī amarānandanātha madhya gā
translated: Bimbeshwari Avva Papau Aim. Ishvara Madhyaga Sri Amarananda Natha Madhyaga

original: vidyeśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ // śrīsadāśiva
analyzed: vidyeśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ śrī sadāśiva
translated: Vidyeshwari Avva Papau Aim. Sri Sadashiva

original: p /
analyzed: p

original: madhyaga śrī avvānaṃdanātha naṃdanādeśvarī carcikā avvā śakreśvarī avvā
analyzed: śrī avvānandanātha naṃdanādeśvarī carcikā avvā śakreśvarī avvā
translated: Madhyaga, Shri, Avva, Anandanatha, Nandadeshwari, Charchika, Avva, Shakreshwari, Avva

original: pāpū aiṃ // ityamarikoghaḥ //
analyzed: aim iti amarikā oghaḥ
translated: Papu Aum. Thus is the Amarika Ugra.

original: śrīḍākinī avvā śrīrākinī avvā śrīlākinī avvā śrīkākinī avvā🔽śrīsākinī avvā śrīhākinī avvā śrīyākinī avvā pāpū aiṃ // iti mātṛkoghaḥ
analyzed: śrī ḍākinī avvā śrīrākinī avvā  śrīlākinī avvā  śrīkākinī  śrīsākinī avvā śrīhākinī avvā  śrīyākinī avvā  pāpū aim iti mātṛkā oghaḥ
translated: Shri Dakini Avva, Shri Rakini Avva, Shri Lakini Avva, Shri Kakini Avva🔽Shri Sakini Avva, Shri Hakini Avva, Shri Yakini Avva, Papu Aum. Thus is the Matrika Ugra.

original: śrīmaṃtrā avvā pāpū aiṃ // śrīsubhagā avvā pāpū aiṃ // śrīsauṃdaryā
analyzed: śrī maṃtrā avvā pāpū aiṃ śrī subhagā aiṃ    śrī sauṃdaryā
translated: Shri Mantra Avva, Papu Aum. Shri Subhaga Avva, Papu Aum. Shri Saubhagya

original: avvā pāpū aiṃ // iti sauṃdaryoghaḥ //
analyzed: aim iti sauṃdarya oghaḥ

analyzed: deva aṃgam kārayet pūrve naivedyam vāyu maṃḍale

analyzed: argham kuryāt dakṣiṇe tu uttare tu jalam tathā

analyzed: saṃskṛta amṛta vījena maṃtra garbhena dhārayet

translated: I will now explain the fourth, as one who knows the rules of the scriptures.🔽Of Vatuka, the Yoginis, and the Kshetrapala, in the directions of Sri Karavira and the cremation ground, then

analyzed: vidikṣu pīṭha vali yogeśvarī vali śrīṣaṭ devī vali vāyavya naiṛtya āgneya

analyzed: p
