analyzed: pāpū aim kaṃṭhe       graṃthi pāpū aim  tālu maṃḍale   śrī rudra graṃthi pāpū aim lalāṭe    śrī  īśvara graṃthi pāpū aiṃ brahmaraṃdhre  haḥ śrī sadāśiva graṃthi
translated: Aim Shrim Granthi Papau Aim (at the palate).🔽Haum Shrim Rudragranthi Papau Aim (at the forehead).🔽Ham Shrim Ishvaragranthi Papau Aim (at the fontanelle).

original: p /
analyzed: p
translated: Hah Shrim Sadashivagranthi Papau Aim (at the top of the head).

original: ṣoḍaśāre pūjyāḥ /
analyzed: ṣoḍaśāre pūjyāḥ
translated: The sixteen goddesses are to be worshipped in the sixteen-petaled lotus.

original: tato bhagavatī cakreśī madhye pūjyāḥ //
analyzed: tatas bhagavatī cakra īśī madhye pūjyāḥ
translated: Then the goddess of the cakra should be worshipped in the middle.

original: caturviṃśāra cakre uparilikhitaṃ ślokadvādaśakaṃ tathā anya aṃgadvā
analyzed: caturviṃśāra cakre upari likhitam śloka dvādaśakam
translated: In the twenty-four-petaled cakra, the twelve verses written above and the other two limbs are to be worshipped.

original: aiṃ // śirasi //
analyzed: aim śirasi
translated: Aim (at the head).

original: bhāṃ bhadrādevī avvā pāpū aiṃ lalāṭe //
analyzed: bhāṃ bhadrādevī avvā pāpū aim lalāṭe
translated: Bham Bhadradevi Avva Papau Aim on the forehead.

original: jiṃ jayādevī pāpū aiṃ dakṣa cakṣuṣi //🔽vuṃ vijayā karālinī devī avvā pāpū aiṃ dakṣakarṇe //
analyzed: jiṃ jayādevī pāpū aim dakṣa cakṣuṣi  vum vijayā karālinī devī avvā pāpū aim dakṣakarṇe
translated: Jim Jayadevi Papau Aim in the right eye.🔽Vum Vijayakaralani Devi Avva Papau Aim in the right ear.

original: vūṃ vikṛtā devī avvā pāpū aiṃ vāmakarṇe //
analyzed: vūm vikṛtā devī avvā pāpū aim vāma karṇe
translated: Vu Vikrita Devi Avva Papau Aim in the left ear.

original: koṭā devī avvā pāpū aiṃ mukhe //🔽bhaiṃ śrī bhūmādevī avvā pāpū aiṃ kaṃṭhe //
analyzed: R koṭā devī avvā pāpū aim mukhe  bhaiṃ śrī bhūmādevī avvā pāpū aim kaṇṭhe
translated: Kota Devi Avva Papau Aim in the mouth.🔽Bham Shri Bhumadevi Avva Papau Aim on the neck.

original: voṃ śrīvāyughaṃṭikādevī avvā pāpū aiṃ hṛdaye //🔽hauṃ śrīhayānanādevī avvā pāpū aiṃ nābhau //
analyzed: voṃ śrī vāyughaṃṭikā devī avvā pāpū aiṃ hṛdaye  hauṃ śrī hayānanā devī avvā pāpū aim nābhau
translated: Vom Shri Vayughantika Devi Avva Papau Aim in the heart.🔽Haum Shri Hayanana Devi Avva Papau Aim in the navel.

original: gaṃ śrīgaṃbhīrādevī avvā pāpū aiṃ svādhiṣṭhāne //
analyzed: gaṃ śrī gaṃbhīrā devī avvā pāpū aiṃ svādhiṣṭhāne
translated: Gam Shri Gambhira Devi Avva Papau Aim in the svadhisthana.

original: bhaḥ śrībhīmabhīṣaṇādevī avvā pāpū aiṃ ādhāre //
analyzed: bhaḥ śrī bhīmabhīṣaṇā devī avvā pāpū aiṃ ādhāre
translated: Bham Shri Bhimabhisana Devi Avva Papau Aim in the base.

original: evaṃ caturviṃśa daleṣu pūjyāḥ // tanmadhye bhagavatī pūjyāḥ // iti
analyzed: evam caturviṃśa daleṣu pūjyāḥ tad madhye bhagavatī pūjyāḥ iti
translated: Thus, they are to be worshipped in the twenty-four petals. In the middle, the Goddess is to be worshipped.

original: caturviṃśāracakraṃ //
analyzed: caturviṃśa ara cakram
translated: This is the twenty-four-spoked wheel.

original: atha dvātriṃśadalaṃ saṃpūjyaṃ // śrīprayāge śrīvikāre🔽p /
analyzed: atha dvātriṃśat alam saṃpūjyam śrī prayāge śrī vikāre  p
translated: Now, the thirty-two-spoked wheel is to be worshipped: Shri Prayaga, Shri Vikara,

original: śrīkullāpure śrī aṭṭahāse śrījayaṃtikā śrīcaritre śrī ekāṃmre śrīdevī
translated: Shri Kullapura, Shri Attahasa, Shri Jayantika, Shri Charitra, Shri Ekamra, Shri Devi,

original: koṭṭe śrīkulūte śrī ujjayinī śrīcaṃdrapure śrīkaravīre śrīlaṃguḍe
analyzed: koṭṭe śrī kulūte śrī ujjayinī śrī caṃdrapure śrī karavīre śrī laṃguḍe
translated: In the fort of Shri Kuluta, in Shri Ujjaini, in Shri Chandra, in Shri Karavira, in Shri Langula,

original: śrī ekavīre śrī śrīnikrame śrīmahālakṣmīvane śrī śrīpadmagulye
translated: In Shri Ekavira, in Shri Shrinikrama, in the great Shri Lakshmi forest, in Shri Shri Padmalya,

original: śrīpippilī śrī aṃgamukhe śrīsiddhaguhāyāṃ śrīvajraguhāyāṃ
translated: In Shri Pippili, in Shri Angamukha, in the Shri Siddha cave, in the Shri Vajra cave,

original: śrīsiṃhoḍḍāra śrīvārāṇasyāṃ śrīgadiharaṇe śrīkasmī
analyzed: śrī siṃhoḍḍāra śrī vārāṇasyām śrī gadiharaṇe
translated: In Shri Simhodara, in Shri Varanasi, in Shri Gadhihara, in Shri Kashmir,

original: śrīprayāse śrīkāṃsāvalyāṃ śrīmahāviṃva śrīvaḍḍipadvāre
translated: In Shri Prayasa, in Shri Kansavali, in Shri Mahavimba, in Shri Vaddhipadvara,

original: śaktuṃ tadā mātarī nyāsaṃ dvātriṃśa siddhayoginī kramaṃ prāgaya trividhaṃ
analyzed: śaktum tadā mātarī nyāsam siddha yoginī kramam prāgaya trividham
translated: Then the thirty-two accomplished yoginis should be worshipped in the three ways, namely, the three, the five, and the seven.

original: saivaddhātṛṃsa ca / m //
analyzed: ca
translated: The same is the case with the others.

original: atha catuḥṣaṣṭhidale madhye bhagavatī cakreśvarī pūjyā // śrī aruṇāvvā pāpū
analyzed: atha catuḥṣaṣṭhi dale madhye bhagavatī cakreśvarī pūjyā
translated: And in the middle of the sixty-four petals, the goddess Chakresvari should be worshipped. Shri Arunavva Papu,

original: aiṃ // evaṃ sarvatra // ugradeva anaṃga
analyzed: aim evam sarvatra ugradevaiḥ anaṃgaiḥ
translated: Aim. The same everywhere. Ugradeva Ananga,

original: p /
analyzed: p
translated: The garland.

original: mālatī piṃgalā nārasiṃhī māheśvarī // hrīṃ phreṃ aṃ brahmāṇī avvā
analyzed: mālatī piṃgalā nārasiṃhī māheśvarī
translated: Malati, Pingala, Narasimhi, Mahesvari. Hrim Phrem Am Brahmani Avva,

original: pāpū aiṃ // iti brahmāṇyāṣṭakaṃ // //
analyzed: aim iti
translated: Papu Aim. Thus the group of eight of Brahmani.

original: kevalī āvalī / mukā arddhacaṃdrā
translated: The solitary garland, the half-moon of Mukha,

original: anāmā vidyādharī amṛtā // hrīṃ phreṃ kaṃ māheśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ //
analyzed: anāmā vidyādharī amṛtā
translated: Anāmā, Vidyādharī, Amṛtā. Hrīṃ Phreṃ Kaṃ, Māheśvarī, Avvā, Pāpū, Aiṃ.

original: iti māheśvaryāṣṭakaṃ // //
analyzed: iti māheśvarya aṣṭakam
translated: Thus the group of eight of Māheśvarī.

original: siṃhā / khecarī bhūcarī🔽gaṇā trivikramā dikcarī // hrīṃ phreṃ caṃ śrīkaumārī avvā pāpū aiṃ // iti
analyzed: gaṇā trivikramā dikcarī                  iti
translated: Siṃhā, Khecarī, Bhūcarī,

original: kaumāryāṣṭakaṃ // //
analyzed: kaumāryāṣṭakam  /
translated: Gaṇā, Trivikrama, Dikccharī. Hrīṃ Phreṃ Chaṃ, Śrī Kaumārī, Avvā, Pāpū, Aiṃ. Thus the group of eight of Kaumārī.

original: kātyāyinī haṃ ra siddhā nīlapatākā tṛpurabhairavī kāmeśvarī // hrīṃ
translated: Kātyāyanī, Haṃ, Siddhā, Nīlapaṭākā, Tripurābhairavī, Kāmeśvarī. Hrīṃ

original: phreṃ ṭaṃ śrīvaiṣṇavī avvā pāpū aiṃ // iti vaiṣṇavyāṣṭakaṃ // //
analyzed: phreṃ ṭaṃ śrīvaiṣṇavī avvā pāpū aim iti vaiṣṇavya aṣṭakam
translated: Phreṃ Ṭaṃ, Śrī Vaiṣṇavī, Avvā, Pāpū, Aiṃ. Thus the group of eight of Vaiṣṇavī.

original: lakṣmī bhadrā subhadrā tvaritā naravāhinī madadravā vajriṇī bhogavatī
translated: Lakṣmī, Bhadrā, Subhadrā, Tvaritā, Naravāhinī, Madadravā, Vajriṇī, Bhogavatī.

original: hrīṃ phreṃ taṃ śrīvārāhī avvā pāpū aiṃ // iti vārāhyāṣṭakaṃ // //🔽jayā vijayā jayaṃtī aparājitā śrīkaṃṭhā saṃhāriṇī vyāpinī vyominī
analyzed: iti vārāhyāṣṭakam
translated: Hrīṃ Phreṃ Taṃ, Śrī Vārāhī, Avvā, Pāpū, Aiṃ. Thus the group of eight of Vārāhī.

original: p /
analyzed: p
translated: Jayā, Vijayā, Jayantī, Aparājitā, Śrīkaṇṭhā, Saṃhāriṇī, Vyāpinī, Vyomīnī.🔽Hrīṃ

original: hrīṃ phreṃ puṃ śrī iṃdrāṇī avvā pāpū aiṃ // iti iṃdrāṇyāṣṭakaṃ // //
analyzed: hrīṃ phreṃ pum śrī indrāṇī aiṃ iti iṃdrāṇī aṣṭakam
translated: Phreṃ Puṃ, Śrī Indrāṇī, Avvā, Pāpū, Aiṃ. Thus the group of eight of Indrāṇī.

original: raktā siddhā śuṣkā utpalā sikhaṃḍī lalitā vināyakī avvā // hrīṃ
analyzed: raktā siddhā śuṣkā utpalā sikhaṃḍī lalitā vināyakī avvā
translated: Rakta, Siddhā, Śuṣkā, Utpala, Sikhāṇḍī, Lalitā, Vināyakī, Avvā. Hrīṃ

original: phreṃ śrī īśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ // iti īśvaryāṣṭakaṃ // // aghoreśvarī vijjā
analyzed: phreṃ śrī īśvarī avvā pāpū aiṃ iti īśvarā aṣṭakam    aghoreśvarī
translated: The Vidyas of Aghoreshwari:

original: sumukhī trikhaṃḍikā ṭūkkinī anaṃtā śaśī śaśinī śrīṃ / pheṃ
translated: Sumukhi, Trikhandhika, Tukkini, Ananta, Shashi, Shashini, Shrim, Phrem.

original: śaṃ śrī cāmuṃḍā avvā pāpū aiṃ // iti cāmuṃḍāṣṭakaṃ // //
analyzed: śam śrī cāmuṃḍā avvā pāpū aim iti cāmuṃḍa aṣṭakam
translated: Shrim Chamundi Avva Papu Aim. Thus is the Ashtaka of Chamundi.

original: iti catuḥṣaṣṭhi devatā catuḥṣaṣṭhidale agrakoṇādārabhya vāmāvarta krameṇa
analyzed: iti catuḥṣaṣṭhi devatā catuḥṣaṣṭhi dale agra koṇāt ārabhya vāma āvarta krameṇa
translated: Thus, the sixty-four deities are to be worshipped in the sixty-four petals, starting from the front corner in an anticlockwise direction.

original: di cakreśvaryāṣṭakaṃ yasthitaṃ catuḥṣaṣṭyārabhya prati
analyzed: cakreśvaryā aṣṭakam catuḥṣaṣṭyā ārabhya prati
translated: The Ashtaka of Chakreshwari is located in the eight petals starting from the sixty-fourth.

original: aṣṭadale tatraiva navamī pūjyā // iti ka
analyzed: aṣṭadale tatra eva navamī pūjyā iti ka
translated: There, the ninth one is to be worshipped. Thus,

original: ṣṭāṃte cakreśvaryaukaikā pūjyāḥ // madhye bhagavatī bhūri
translated: at the end of the Ashtakas, each Chakreshwari is to be worshipped. In the center, the goddess Bhuvarnashreshtha Chakreshwari is to be worshipped.

original: varṇacakreśvarī pūjyāḥ //🔽ataḥ paraṃ vāhya catuḥṣaṣṭyāredaśamama
analyzed: varṇa cakra īśvarī pūjyāḥ  atas param vāhya
translated: The goddess Bhuvarnashchakreshwari is to be worshipped.

original: śīti maṃḍalāni agrādārabhya vāmāvarta krameṇa pūjyāḥ // iti
analyzed: śīti maṃḍalāni agrāt ārabhya vāma āvarta krameṇa pūjyāḥ iti
translated: After this, in the outer sixty-four-spoked wheel, the ten-spoked mandala is to be worshipped starting from the front in an anticlockwise direction. Thus,

original: nityanaimittikavidhiḥ samāptāḥ //
translated: the procedure of daily and occasional rites is completed.
